Ratings.comment: Excellent professor! Chrissy is super nice and personable and gives amazing feedback. There was never a time in her class where I didn't feel respected or heard and I would take another one of her classes in an instant
Chrissy did a good job with this class. I had lots of questions, and she answered them all. I will take another class with her if I can!
I took 6188 Field Prep with Chrissy. It was half a semester long. The class was very straightforward. Assignments did not take long to complete.

I took the condensed 8-week summer course for SW 5001. While the professor is nice, approachable and leaves a lot of helpful comments on posts and assignments & while the modules are really beneficial to improve documentation skills, be prepared for a lot of work, assignments and at least 2 lengthy discussion posts per week for only 2 credit hours!
She's a nice person and the class is really easy simply because its just the basics of Communication. but yeah she's funny and nice but everyone takes her seriously.

I did not have a good time in this class. Sandra Facemire's feedback is so unbelievably rude, mean spirited, and unprofessional, it made me feel bad about myself as a person. She leaves no room for error and even knowing the fact that we are students that are learning, she's still unrelenting and less than sympathetic. Protect your mental health

Compared to other professors she clearly goes way beyond her duties as an instructor. She is the only one so far that took the time to make personalized videos with herself talking to us. The feedback was so helpful. A genuinely caring professor. I hope to have her for other courses. She was hands down five stars all the way!! Course# 6501
Jason Stofel is one of the best professors I've ever had at OSU. He is personable and well prepared. He's got tons of experience in the field and it shows. He teaches from the heart.

Jason was great about responding. I felt that he was a fair grader; just follow the rubric to a "T" and you'll be fine. There is just a lot to do even when there are big assignments due. He would respond to most of my emails within a few days and held live class lectures to go over material and answer questions. 10/10 would take again.

Jason is really good at answering emails, and also answering questions in class. Lectures are pretty entertaining because he uses examples from his time in the field, and encourages students to talk about their own experiences. I am normally not an 8 AM person, but I actually looked forward to starting my week off with Jason.

I had Jason last semester and chose to take another of one of his classes this semester. As a social work major you know how dreading these 3 hour lectures can be. But Jason is hilarious, he engages students in the lecture so you'll be alert and answering good questions. He always connects his lecture to his experiences. Definitely recommend him!

I learned so much in his class. He loves what he does and has so much insight. Assignments were decently easy. In class role play gave some really good practice for using the techniques we were learning about. Great professor, personable, knowledgeable, and made class a good time.

I have taken two of his classes. Really nice teacher. Gives different perspectives on topics along with his personal experience. He likes to engage with all of his students. As long as you try he will give you a good grade.

Jason is genuinely amazing at what he does. His empathy and care for others shines through every class. The way he talks about working with family systems and individuals struggling with mental health is truly inspiring. I learned so much from him and only hope to have the opportunity to work with him in the future. A+ professor and an A+ human.
Hes a good dude who provides a lot of good information and tips for practicing within family systems.

One of the most indoctrinating professors I've met. We're taught to be ashamed of our race and country. Our first paper is about identities/family history, specifically what our gender/sexual orientation is and when/why we discovered it. This class is more about agreeing with her than learning SW skills. Be ready to agree blindly for good grades.
Professor Severson is so nice!!! She leads students to finish all the homework in class, so this saves me a lot of time. She is kind and caring. I really recommend taking the off-line course.

Andrea was a very caring professor. Last semester, I took her for GE Launch and she understood that students have lots of stress as it is and made it so if you attended her classes in person, you could get all required work done and have nothing outside of class. She also removed assignments that she didn't believe were useful. Take her if you can!
My favorite professor at this school. Genuinely kind. Very passionate about social work.

She is so nice. Launch seminar is already a really easy class but she ended up just removing a good 5 assignments and we did not have to do them because she thought they were expecting us to do too much work. If you do the assignments its impossible to not pass. Class is pass/fail.

Such a kind, passionate professor, really cares about students as individuals and took the time to get to know everyone and speak to everyone. Helped me out beyond what the course content entailed with my academic journey. Simplified the work  to get the most out of it. Good professor to take this class with, made it more enjoyable.

Andrea is a fantastic professor and I would take more classes with her if she had them available. I have rarely had a professor as kind and thoughtful as she is. It's clear she's an amazing social worker and I hope I will be able to impact my future clients the way that she does.
Andrea is amazing! She is always available for questions, and is so passionate about social work.

Andrea is both my advisor and my 1100 professor and she is amazing. She is so caring and has helped me with so many things that I would get a headache trying to count. She is a great person and really cares about students. Take her if you have the chance!

I have never met someone as caring and empathetic as Andrea. She is truly a champion of her students and wants nothing more than for us to succeed and go on to become fantastic social workers. I'll carry what I learned this semester with me for the rest of my life. If you ever have the chance to take a class with her, absolutely do it.

I adore Andrea. She gives clear lectures and is always willing to rephrase something or answer questions to clarify. Always participate in her class! She's an easy and fair grader. She is very obviously liberal and is incredibly vocal about her political opinions (I took her class during an election year), so be prepared for it if that bothers you.
She is awesome & this has been my favorite class of college. She actually helps you learn & is very kind to her students!
Really great teacher.
Best professor I have ever encountered. Her passion for teaching burns like a wild fire.

Andrea is incredible. If you can get into her class (if it isn't already full) SCHEDULE WITH HER. She is passionate about what she teaches and is always willing to listen to your thoughts and feelings and just cares so much about her students. You need to go to class, but the workload is small. She is hands down the best professor I've ever had.
A phenomenal teacher

Andrea is such a great instructor! I only took her for the Intro to OSU class (basically a free "A") but she is also my advisor and I absolutely love going to meet with her. She has a way of making me feel empowered so that I feel like I can accomplish anything! Life goal: be able to positively impact people the way Andrea does. Highly recommend.

Just had her for my survey course, but it is so easy to see how passionate she is about social work. So optimistic and full of energy also. As she is also an academic adviser, she can help with lots of different things. Really listens to students and tries to help them however she can!
easy teacher. dont be late or miss class- she hates it

The instructor dropped me from the course for not participating. I submitted all online assignments, but she didn't like that I waited until Saturday (the day they were due) to complete them. I was reenrolled in the class, but it was difficult to learn from her.

This professor critiques you for not including things you didn't even know were expected to include. Her feedback is often not helpful at all and her assignment instructions are vague and poorly written, leaving students confused about what's required.

I dismiss reviews mentioning profs marking students down for not sharing their opinion as some kind of dogwhistles for conservative students feeling persecuted by liberal values, but in this case Prof. Rees does actually grade arbitrarily according to her agreement with you rather than the rubric. Asking for more clarity goes nowhere.

This class was easy, but the grading was awfully strict. What is with APA format? Who uses that? Also, the quizzes barely match the coursework content. When you make a mistake formatting in APA, good luck finding a solution because the solutions she references doesn't show you how to do anything. Was ghosted after asking a question about my grade.

I have taken SWK3597 (online) and SWK7516 (in person), in both classes I found that Prof Rees grades fairly and offers a curve when warranted. After reading other reviews, I was concerned to take her 7516 course, but I can't recommend taking it with her enough if you are interested in the material! She was passionate and flexible with assignments.

I would suggest steering very clear of this professor. Expect a bad grade if you don't have the same beliefs as she does or include those beliefs in your papers. Don't share your opinions in class unless they match up with hers.

Terrible. Grades too harshly and offers few points so it's hard to fix a bad grade. Very little help when questions are asked, figure it out yourself. Gives heavy lectures with an insane amount of reading and then offers 10-question quizzes with extremely specific questions. Has some outrageous ideologies and constantly shares these in class.

Professor Reese did a poor job teaching. She often rambled in class, passionately pushed her views, and awkwardly approached sensitive subjects. She did not do a good job staying on point or being sensitive about difficult topics. I would highly recommend avoiding her as a teacher. I'm sure she's a nice person, but not a great teacher.

Professor Reese was one of the worst teachers I've had. She tended to become very preachy in class. She struggled to present material concisely and often rambled. She frequently told the class that she would let us out early and then proceeded to keep us late. She also doesn't post a schedule for the quizzes until the week of the quiz.
Slow at grading. Long email response time. Office hours by appointment only. If you disagree with her views be prepared to take point deductions. Never take her if you can think for yourself.

Grades generously if you have the right "idea" in your papers and discussion boards but grades harshly if you do not. In this class it is best to say your opinions line up with the material no matter what. There are lot of videos in the coursework, no lecture. Rees does not give substantive feedback but the material isn't difficult so it is okay.

Awful experience; I hope to never encounter her again. What others describe as "passionate" I call Soapbox city. You will be in no doubt of how she feels about politics and social issues. Ridiculous grading and attendance policies. A nit-picker over every little thing but inconsistent with how and when criteria is applied. My only advice is; don't

This professor is amazing, she keeps class engaged. However there are group projects and I HATE group projects. But she works with you every step of the way. She is fair and doesn't sugar coat things. She acknowledges that her students can feel overwhelmed and makes an effort to help in anyway she can. She makes class fun yet very challenging.

Gwen is a caring, committed teacher. She really appreciates participation, but is one of the few teachers who realizes that some students can engage without always being vocal. We spent a lot of time discussing current events, which I find is relevant to our education but others may not like. She is always willing to accept helpful feedback.

Gwen was an incredible instructor. She was the most committed to her students instructor I met in the entire college. The department is blessed she's a part of the  team. I didn't even get a good grade (my fault) in her  class which goes to show how much I appreciated the learning experience regardless. Take her if you want to really learn!

Gwen is awesome! I am taking her next semester as well! Textbook is required and you will need it. Her lectures are intuitive, interactive, and easy to understand.  She lets you speak your mind and is always open for interpretation.  Exams are fairly easy if you take notes and study.
He's very dry and uninterested. I'm not sure why the energy was so dull and offputting.
Roy values clarity and conciseness over arbitrary word counts and busy work. This course taught me a lot and I will use what I learned for the rest of my career. He's an excellent instructor!

Don't sleep on Roy, I'm so happy I had the opportunity to learn from him these last two semesters. He is concise, and clear and provides great feedback. He also makes a point to talk about the real challenges in social work with his daily tips. I appreciate his insight, he's a great leader and professor. OSU is lucky to have him

Roy is great. Second class I've taken with him. He wants you to be successful and will work with you to get you to where you need to be. He gives good feedback and understands the stress grad students are dealing with. He keeps things light and recognizes when he makes mistakes, often finding a way to joke about them.

Roy has an awesome, quirky sense of humor. He was humble and it was obvious he loved his job. He did a fantastic job of making a very dry and tedious subject (stats in Social Work) as palatable and understandable as possible. He graded on if you showed up and tried to learn, not whether you get it "right". Pretty refreshing to be honest.

Roy is amazing! He really cares about the students and states that as long as you do the work and put in effort you will pass. His lectures are very easy to understand (despite the fact that it was an evidence course so term heavy). He broke everything down and was very clear on requirements.

Mr. Roy is an amazing and down to earth professor. He goes the extra mile to make sure you understand the assignment or what is being discussed, tries to make everything funny, and very understanding! If you dont pass his class with an A you completely did none of your work and made zero effort. Communication with him will take you a long way

He wants you to do well. He will work with you as much as he can to ensure that you understand what you need to do. He goes above and beyond any other instructor I have ever had. He is a great instructor, I highly recommend taking your evaluation course with him, as he will work with you to ensure you succeed.

I appreciated Sandra Facemire's thorough feedback, though the class content itself was confusing. I had some trouble because I felt like a lot of the assignments were not black and white and it sort of felt like she graded as if they were. Overall, I still got an A, so I can't really complain, but I don't know that I'd take a class like this again

I did not have a good time in this class. Sandra Facemire's feedback is so unbelievably rude, mean spirited, and unprofessional, it made me feel bad about myself as a person. She leaves no room for error and even knowing the fact that we are students that are learning, she's still unrelenting and less than sympathetic. Protect your mental health

Compared to other professors she clearly goes way beyond her duties as an instructor. She is the only one so far that took the time to make personalized videos with herself talking to us. The feedback was so helpful. A genuinely caring professor. I hope to have her for other courses. She was hands down five stars all the way!! Course# 6501

Jason is a very attentive professor. He has clear grading standards, leaves very precise feedback, and is very generous when an extension is needed. He offers extra credit by way of a syllabus scavenger hunt that gives a good amount of cushion. He is also a pretty funny and laid back guy. I would take any class with Jason again.
Jason Stofel is one of the best professors I've ever had at OSU. He is personable and well prepared. He's got tons of experience in the field and it shows. He teaches from the heart.

Jason was great about responding. I felt that he was a fair grader; just follow the rubric to a "T" and you'll be fine. There is just a lot to do even when there are big assignments due. He would respond to most of my emails within a few days and held live class lectures to go over material and answer questions. 10/10 would take again.

Lectures are pretty entertaining because he uses examples from his time in the field, and encourages students to talk about their own experiences. I am normally not an 8 AM person, but I actually looked forward to starting my week off with Jason.

But Jason is hilarious, he engages students in the lecture so you'll be alert and answering good questions. He always connects his lecture to his experiences. Definitely recommend him!

I learned so much in his class. He loves what he does and has so much insight. Assignments were decently easy. In class role play gave some really good practice for using the techniques we were learning about. Great professor, personable, knowledgeable, and made class a good time.

I have taken two of his classes. Really nice teacher. Gives different perspectives on topics along with his personal experience. He likes to engage with all of his students. As long as you try he will give you a good grade.

Jason is genuinely amazing at what he does. His empathy and care for others shines through every class. The way he talks about working with family systems and individuals struggling with mental health is truly inspiring. I learned so much from him and only hope to have the opportunity to work with him in the future. A+ professor and an A+ human.
Hes a good dude who provides a lot of good information and tips for practicing within family systems.
Chrissy was an okay professor. I felt like the content was fine and she was accessible for when I had questions relating to my EBP application, but for the most part she didn't do much teaching.

Excellent professor! Chrissy is super nice and personable and gives amazing feedback. There was never a time in her class where I didn't feel respected or heard and I would take another one of her classes in an instant
Chrissy did a good job with this class. I had lots of questions, and she answered them all. I will take another class with her if I can!

Eunha is an awesome professor. I took her asynchronous Family Caregiving class to fulfill an elective requirement for my MSW. Out of all my online classes, she is the only one that has bothered to record actual lecture videos rather than walls of text for course material. She is clearly a kind and passionate professor.

He wants you to do well. He will work with you as much as he can to ensure that you understand what you need to do. He goes above and beyond any other instructor I have ever had. He is a great instructor, I highly recommend taking your evaluation course with him, as he will work with you to ensure you succeed.

This class was one of my favorite classes I have taken at OSU. Prof. Marx is great. This class was very interesting and I loved the assignments he gave us. This class is not super easy, but you can earn an A if you do what is asked of you. I would take this class again if I could.
Professor Marx is a great teacher. The feedback from discussion posts and papers is thoughtful. You can tell he cares about his students.

Professor Marx started the semester with a lecture on what to expect in the course. It was a macro SW class, so the material was pretty dry. He was passionate about it, though, which helped. He sent weekly emails about the coursework, lots of examples for assignments, and gave great feedback. Great professor.

I took an asynchronous online class with Robert. He was very responsive to questions and showed a willingness to help me understand the assignments. The assignments built on each other, and he seemed passionate about exploring ideas with students. The online modules were dry, but I would definitely take a class by Robert again.
He actually cares about student learning. Great feedback. Treats students with dignity.

Professor Marx is great! He is VERY responsive via email and text (1 hour response time) and gives amazing feedback on every assignment. He is also a very fair (easy) grader as well. He truly wants everyone to learn as much as possible. I would recommend taking a course from him and look forward to taking more courses with him again in the future.
Professor Marx is very knowledgeable about Assessment and Diagnosis and makes learning the DSM easy!
he's an easy grader and you can learn a lot from his labs
This was the crisis intervention class I took with Professor Marx. He is a good communicator and gives great feedback. He is lenient and really provides good instruction about the material.

Marx is a brilliant clinician and professor. I agree that his lectures do tend to get boring at times, but if you can make yourself focus you will learn a lot from him. Do the assignments and you'll get an A. I've taken 2 classes with him and I'd take him again. He is always willing to help in any way that he can and gives great feedback.

Marx is the nicest professor you could ask for, he will answer any question no matter if takes over class time. He assigns tons of readings, but you can get away with doing the minimum. He is very knowledgeable- but his lectures are very long and dry. He's nice and an easy grader, but if you cant do boring lectures he is not for you.

Very knowledgeable. Lectures are very long and boring and tends to talk in circles and doesn't stay on topic. Assignments are very extensive but not difficult if you take the time to do them. He isn't extremely clear on what he wants on them but will take the time out to answer any questions.  Expect to read tons of articles for this class.
He has high standards but understands we are all human
Prof. Bobson's class was good. It wasn't my favorite, but it was informative and not too hard.

Class SWK 4503-0040, Spring 2024
If I am not mistaken this was the first time this class was offered online. It is tough to do group projects, but towards the middle of the semester things started to run smooth. There were too many assignments going on in her class for a couple different weeks, so yes there is stress, but would take again.
Sue is one of THE BEST professors in the college of social work. I would definitely take a class with her again (Ive already taken two) but Im a Masters level student now.
Great teacher. Will help you if you are struggling with something. Responds super quick. Easy grader. Way too much homework EACH week.

Each week was a single prerecorded lecture that focused on a different social working document. These were poorly done as she never actually showed any examples of what each document should look like. Therefore, you have to guess what the assignments should look like finished each week. She's a lenient grader to make up for it though.

This is a pass/fail class. Sue is very kind and has a bubbly personality. There are roleplays with your peers so it's best to attend class. Assignments are fairly easy. Most classes are somewhat lecture-heavy, and then there is practice time for roleplays. Sue talks about experiences in the social work field, which I found helpful for my future.

She is a kind and encouraging professor. She provides a lot of good feedback. Lenient grading if you are making the effort. She is very prompt on grading and providing weekly summaries. You can tell she genuinely cares about students and teaching.

This class (engaging and entering the profession) was a great class! The professor was great with communication and very engaged with her students. There were sure a lot of assignments but they were not research-based. It was a rewarding class for

Sue is very nice and as long as you show up and put effort into her class, you will do well. Class time is devoted mostly to lecture, but she gives at least 30 min each week for groups to work on their projects. Lectures aren't super engaging and you likely won't be challenged, but you will love Sue.
Prof. Peck is great! Her discussion posts and quizzes are not too hard, but also very informative. I enjoyed this class very much.

Professor Peck actually recorded lectures for this class. They were helpful. She gave good feedback, and I learned a ton. She was invested in the class and sent out weekly emails. My issue with her is that her grading is slow. She did not grade the final paper at all. It was worth 40% of the grade, and she just submitted grades without grading.
Shes an amazing professor who genuinely cares about the students. This is the second class Ive taken with her and shes a big part of the reason Im going on to pursue my MSW!

Prof. Peck is a pleasure! The course is fascinating, and she really goes above and beyond for you when you have a problem. She really does care and does what she can to help if you are struggling. So thankful for her.
She is an amazing professor! Whenever I had an issue, she was so compassionate and understanding! Already signed up to take another class with her.

This class was not my favorite. Prof. Dixon is a good guy, but the workload of this class is insane for a 3 credit class. There were several weeks where his class took more time than the rest of my other classes combined. He assigns hundreds of pages of readings and multiple videos every week. I would choose a different instructor if possible.

Mr. Dixon was an outstanding teacher and provided feedback with great detail. He definitely cares about the field of social work and his students. He provides opportunities for students to turn in late work. Although I found the class assignments to be well spaced out. It was nice to see his understanding and flexibility.

Dr. Dixon is kind and accessible. He is lenient with deadlines and willing to work with students who are sincere. His motto is that deadlines arent as important as learning. For his Live Zoom calls he would have guest speakers come in and they provided great insight into the field of social work. I would 1000% take another class with him.

fantastic 
wonderful

Raegan is very relatable and is willing to adjust due dates for her students. She genuinely cares about you, your success, and your life outside of the classroom. She is a great instructor and knows how to create a good learning environment.

A great professor! She is very patient with grading and does care if you pass her class!! She cares a lot for her students which a lot of professors don't. She gives good feedback on papers and is easy to reach out to with any questions. She keeps the work interesting as well even though some subjects can be heavy topics.

She is so amazing. If you have the chance, please take any of her classes. It was only her second semester teaching, and she is doing it flawlessly. She's very inspirational, understanding, caring, and honestly just the embodiment of the perfect instructor. Participate in her class! She loves to hear from you and loves to have class conversations.
She is absolutely amazing and so understanding. For this being her first year teaching, she's doing an amazing job. She is one of my favorites and I always look forward to her class.

She's an attorney, so she is extremely logic-based, an issue for some people in the social work world to understand. Her assignments are crystal clear, her rubrics are neat and tidy, and her instructions for assignments are succinct. I have had so many professors at the CSW that don't know how to write instructions for assignments in less than 1 pg

Avoid her and this class at all costs. Expects social work students to have an understanding of legal writing and legal concepts. Does truly nothing to prepare us for what she expects out of us and offers minimal feedback. She treats a 5000 level social work class like a 1L law course.

People may say she is a rough grader but I truly think it is because she wants you to succeed. She gives great feedback on assignments. It is incredibly detailed and she also is very helpful when you need help during class. Her syllabus sounds intimidating but don't let it scare you. She is an amazing professor.

Professor Breidigan is one of the best instructors I have had in the social work department. Her expectation are clear and her feedback is personalized and helpful. You are required to meet all assignment expectations and engage with the course material. I appreciate that after her lectures, I feel more prepared and confident to enter the field.

I'd love to see her as a therapist because in the way she grades, you'd expect that she NEVER makes any mistakes. She expects 100% perfection and I'm wondering if she's able to do that herself in her own work. She's simply pasting feedback written previously and doesn't engage critically with my ideas. I do not recommend her by any means.

She is a harsh grader and docks you points no matter what. Don't ask for an extension because she will give you a substitute assignment that is longer and harder than the original assignment. Also, do not ask for help she will just cite your lecture notes and not give any further explanation. I would steer clear of this professor.

Professor Breidigan is such a hard grader. She will dock you points for any little mistake. I would avoid taking any courses with her. Also, no extension offered but will give you the option to complete an alternate assignment that is way harder and more time consuming than the original assignment.
Professor Kelly was amazing in both the undergraduate and graduate program. Her rubrics are very clear and make expectations easily met. Would recommend taking her courses.

Kelley is an overly harsh grader, one of those Professors who will always subtract at least one point no matter what. Assignment criteria are vague but you will be graded with the expectation of complete perfectionism every time. For example, you lose points in discussion posts if you don't cite the discussion posts.

Kelley has by far been one of my favorite professors I've had- her teaching is thorough and her feedback was incredible. The role-playing aspect made me anxious but once I accepted the uncomfortable aspect of it and just really focused on how to utilize the skills being taught, I came to very much appreciate it.

Bro, we had to write an assessment. She said mine did not have enough info. I'm not wordy, I got straight to the point. I added fluff - NOTHING of Substance and she said it was great after I BSed it. LAMEEE.

Professor Breidigan is very knowledgeable about the course content. The classes are lecture-heavy but filled with useful information. The key to success in this class- TAKE NOTES! When she gives examples of how to use a skill, WRITE DOWN THOSE EXAMPLES! This will help tremendously when preparing for the midterm and final.

When I walked into this class on the first day, I thought it was going to be my problem class. The class does a lot of role play to prep the student for the midterm and final assignments. The prof gives amazing feedback, and doesn't expect you to do the skills perfectly but sees the effort you put in. I signed up for 3502 with her and can't wait.

Feedback discouraged critical thinking, anything besides transcription + regurgitation. Defensive when asked about it. Disenfranchising. Important topic, so class should have been harder. Needed more required skills practice; only practice was graded final. Would NOT take again.

Kelley definitely knows what she is talking about. The problem is she talks way too fast, and her midterm and finals are unnecessarily difficult and confusing. She isnt very clear in what she wants and she often seems to have a bad attitude if you dont understand what is going on in the class. Dont take. Only grade on attendance and finals/mid.

Overall, good instructor. Very knowledgeable & enthusiastic about teaching the course, but had EXTREMELY high expectations of you and expects you to understand & be a perfectionist in assignments even though youre teaching yourself. Also isnt really the most understanding & expects you to make her class the #1 priority in your life.

Compared to other professors I have taken at OSU, her class is harder and we get through more content. However, If you actually want to get what you pay for in your education, take her. her lectures are extremely informative and she explains complicated material in great ways that are easy to grasp. Best teacher I actually learned from. brilliant.

Kelley is an amazing lecturer. She knows the material in and out. I always learn something. The readings are the launching point. Her grading criteria is very clear. Her rubrics are amazing! She also will take the time to talk with you and help you in any way she can. Kelley will make accommodations and offer you as much support as she can.
Her lectures really flew by even though it was a three hour class! She's awesome!
Do your work and read and you will be fine.

New to Ohio State and she was amazing. Very informative and excited about her profession. She made real life expectations with assignments and kept it 100%. Very talkative and long winded but she knows her stuff!

I was excited every week for my Friday afternoon class. Friday. Afternoon. She treats everyone fairly, makes the long lectures enjoyable (especially if you want to go into private practice), and has so many experiences she uses as examples. I usually teared up a few times each class.
She had good power points
Probably my only instructor this semester who actually makes me want to be a social worker. Very inspiring, passionate about what she does, and still in the field. Hoping I get her classes again!

She is very knowledgable and passionate about what she does. She is still in the field so she always has real examples and stories. Her lectures keep you engaged and the time passes quickly. She is very straightforward about what she is looking for on each assignment.

Kelley is hands-down my favorite professor. I love her lectures because she has so much experience to share for practically every topic discussed. Time always flies during her lectures and I find it extremely easy to stay focused. Her assignments are clear and she give great feedback. I will take her for any class I can!

Kelley has a lot of experience but has not forgotten starting out. Her lectures are practical and supportive of the new social worker.  She covers a lot of material, with no wasted time; yet she is entertaining and insightful at the same time. She won't force you to participate but you're cheating yourself if you don't; it's a participatory field!

Professor P is an amazing instructor. She is fair in her grading and provides feedback that is helpful. She has three extra credit opportunities that also explain the assignments in more detail. I enjoyed Professor P so much. I am taking her again. You will love Professor P!

Professor Purvis is my favorite professor at Ohio State. She cares about the subject matter and interacts with students. She has three Zoom meetings a semester to go over course material. Her feedback is helpful and relevant. She is also an honest grader. I had to work to earn an A in her class, but I actually learned something about the subject.
Social work so not super interesting and not too difficult for a GE class. Nothing crazy with papers either.

Professor Purvis is a great teacher. I enjoyed learning the subject matter. She offered three extra credit sessions during the semester to give extra explanations for subject matter and assignments. I liked her class so much that I signed up to take another one with her next semester.

Professor Purvis was a fair grader, but did not seem incredibly interested in guiding students. She was a little hard to get a hold of, and I would say mildly helpful with feedback. Though I would take her class again, she may not be my first choice.

Professor Purvis is passionate about teaching development. She offered 3 extra credit sessions throughout the course which were helpful for the points and extra clarification. Can be a tough grader, but is fair!

Professor Purvis is amazing! She really knows the material well and teaches it in a way that is very understandable. Even though the class was asynchronous, she had three live lectures that were for extra credit. The only warning I have is Professor Purvis follows the rubric and assignment outlines to the T.

She did not convey the aspects of the vignettes and when she did it was after she gave you an unfair grade. Half the time her reasonings did not make any sense as what she said was not listed, in fact was. Will never take her again. The only plus side is, she allows extra credit.

One of the toughest professor's I have taken despite my high engagement with the course. She provides very vague feedback, and the rubric expectations are vague. Willing to meet one-on-one but will repeat the same vague feedback. Grading criteria and course materials is not difficult content that is covered but did not gain insight from the prof.

I have taken 3 courses with Professor P in my first two semesters, I will be taking an elective with her this summer. She is a fantastic professor and resource. I have found her live sessions enjoyable and she gives great feedback. She grades according to the rubric, so as long as you follow that closely, you're good.

This will be my third course I have taken with Tiana Purvis. She has been great with her response time it is usually within the hour or two. She gives great feedback she does follow the rubric very well which sometimes makes her a tough grader but its very easy to get all your points on an assignments. I plan on taking other courses with her.

Shes a very kind person and willing to speak to students, however she does not provide comprehensive feedback and is very rigid when it comes to grading and giving credit. Despite her openness to meet she is not very open to adjusting grades. Since there arent many assignments in the course this can quickly destroy your grade.
I would take another class that she teaches.

I enjoyed my time in professor Purviss class because she was caring and I found the information we learned quite interesting. Sometimes I would get a little overwhelmed with going through the modules and DBs but overall great class and professor!!

The grading criteria for the papers is so vague. Diversity and inclusion is a very broad topic area, and the papers are supposed to be short (3-5 pages) and cover very, very broad topic areas that arent really well defined. It left me writing very vaguely which was then graded really tough. I dont know, just wasnt a good class.

Great professor, really cares about her students and students feel as if they can really talk to her about either their classes or other personal issues that arise in the semester. She makes what could be a very boring class into one that is entertaining and engaging compared to my other classes.
Easy class, strict with grading guidelines, used the textbook 1 time.

Ms. Galligher is a tough and sometimes not a clear grader. I submitted a paper she took points off for not including to write a certain topic in two different places. She also took points off for something, that was reported to not be in a video, but was in the video. The group project directions are not very clear.
I would not recommend her to anyone. She doesn't care if you pass or fail, and she certainly doesn't give you the help you need to succeed. She is slow to reply to messages and she is a slow grader.

Arianna was an alright professor. She wasn't particularly "hard", but she definitely has her own views and if you state something in your papers that don't align with HER views, she will emphasize that, but she never took off points for that difference of opinions/ views. She's a bit pushy with her views, but makes up for it with her kind feedback.

I took this class as a last minute elective so I was nervous. However, I found the class interesting it shows Professor Galigher is passionate about this topic. I found it to be busy, but not overwhelming as an elective course!

Discussion boards are to spark a conversation between students based on their perception of the content. I am not sure where her grading skills came from because I have never in my life encountered such a critical grader. If you do not have HER views associated with the discussion. It appears everything is one sided. Be prepared to lose points!
I took 5002. I wouldn't recommend this professor. Feedback is slow as well as grading.

Arianna is an acquired-taste kind of teacher. For this class in particular, she was a huge stickler for reading the textbook with a fine tooth comb to pass the quizzes. The questions on her quizzes are tricky and sometimes impossible. She seems to be very experienced and passionate about social work. It seemed that about half the class liked her.

Her Interviewing class is the most useful course I've taken in my entire college career. I use the things she teaches every single day! She's really sweet, will answer every question that is asked, and is thorough in the subject matter. Pro tip: for the midterm and final projects, work with a classmate. Those are the only things you're graded on.

I really liked Arianna. She is very passionate about caring for people and advocating for them. I wasn't sure how I liked her at first, but she grew on me. Her personality is just very inviting and calming. We never had any exams and we only had  couple of assignments. Not a difficult A! Never used the textbook! I'm taking her again for 3501.

Best class I've taken- so much fun. We would and talk as a group for half of class and then the other half we would do activities like dodgeball, basketball, etc. Had one presentation, a paper, "final" (online) and then like easy reading assignments. Such an easy A (easy grader) and highly recommend as a GE. Jerry is super entertaining and great!

Took this class as part of the new GEs and really enjoyed it, 1 3 hr class/week, first part is lecture second part is activities in the gym. Jerry is amazing and super understanding, I would take the class again just for him! However if this class says itll be at the ARC- DO NOT TAKE IT was not worth the extra 1 hr travel time just to go to class

This class was the best class I have every taken in my life. Jerry is hilarious and makes it a lot of fun. You basically get to play games and learn about how simple games can change a kids life, while also bonding with your peers. If you go to class and take notes, its easy to pass, just pay attention. Would definitely suggest!

TAKE THIS CLASS! It is super easy and fun. You get to play games and bond with the other students in the class. If you show up and occasionally read the assignments, you'll pass with flying colors. The final and assignments are very easy and won't take you much time. There is little work to do outside of class.
She is very passionate about the course and cares about each of her students. The class is graded on only a handful of assignments, all of which are pretty easy.
One of my favorite professors. I loved her as a person and teacher!

Alexis is one of the best professors I have had at OSU. She cares about her students and the material a lot, the class is very little work, and as long as you build a relationship with her she is very understanding.
Professor Winfield was good. Provided clear grading expectations and provided the material needed to be successful.

The course was super easy. However, she is so picky about grading, like taking points off if you don't include the names of those you're responding to in discussion replies. Half of the time, what she says in her announcements/emails doesn't make sense. She's also unforgiving about late work. I bet she's fine in person, but she's terrible online.

Literally the best professor I've had at OSU. I'm graduating in two weeks and I'm so grateful I took her class for my last semester. Her lecture is engaging and real life based, materials are closely updated with current ongoing situations. She is fun and open-minded, and is very helpful if you need any academic or career advice from her. Love!
Best teacher i had all quarter.
Alexis is the best instructor I have taken at OSU by far! She is funny, entertaining and fair. Her class requires attendance but it is very interesting and you learn a lot. Great professor!

Wonderful!!!  The class is definitely as easy as everyone says.  Going to class is a must though.  While we do sit around and talk, you do learn quite a bit about being a social worker and about teenage pregnancy.  Social Work 597 is a must take with her at OSU!
Great instructor! Laid back, easy assignments. If you attend class, pay attention and participate...then you are guaranteed an A! She is very funny also! Highly recommend!

The class is very easy + you will learn a lot with her. There is only one test during the entire class and it is pass or fail. There are also 2 1-page papers and one presentation. Also, many extra credit opportunities. She is very funny and nice!!!
SOo interesting and SOo easy! tAkE hER! I learned soo much.

As easy as advertised. Her class is a joke. Midterm is pass/fail, and she tells you enough answers before it so there's no way you can fail. Final project is a joke, just copy her format and put ur ideas in and you get the easiest A of your life. Class sucks overall, you wont learn anything worth while.

She is awesome! The one test is pass/fail you only have to get a 62% on multiple choice questions which she pretty much details before the exam.  You don't need to read the books.  You also have to write two one page reaction papers on whatever you would like.  Easiest and most interesting class so far.  She changes your perspective.  Take her!

I took this class thinking it would be easy as people said. It is a bad class. Topics are easy and Winfield is late to class by 5-10 minutes everyday. Books are not needed and waste of money to buy. Final project will kill you. doesn't go over it. one mistake will get you an F in class since project almost 50% of grade. VERY poor email contact.

She is one of the funniest ladies ever. It's not a pointless class either, it exposes people who've been sheltered (like me) to what is going on outside of the bubble. I really enjoyed it. Go to class and be entertained, do virtually NO work, and get an A... what could be better?

I had to drag myself to this class. Yes, drag. It was awful. Most of the other students loved it because all we did was sit around and gossip. But for what we talked about in class I would have rather been at home. If you don't mind going to a pointless class to get an easy A, then take this course. But it really wasn't for me.
Professor Severson is so nice!!! She leads students to finish all the homework in class, so this saves me a lot of time. She is kind and caring. I really recommend taking the off-line course.

Andrea was a very caring professor. Last semester, I took her for GE Launch and she understood that students have lots of stress as it is and made it so if you attended her classes in person, you could get all required work done and have nothing outside of class. She also removed assignments that she didn't believe were useful. Take her if you can!
My favorite professor at this school. Genuinely kind. Very passionate about social work.

She is so nice. Launch seminar is already a really easy class but she ended up just removing a good 5 assignments and we did not have to do them because she thought they were expecting us to do too much work. If you do the assignments its impossible to not pass. Class is pass/fail.

Such a kind, passionate professor, really cares about students as individuals and took the time to get to know everyone and speak to everyone. Helped me out beyond what the course content entailed with my academic journey. Simplified the work  to get the most out of it. Good professor to take this class with, made it more enjoyable.

Andrea is a fantastic professor and I would take more classes with her if she had them available. I have rarely had a professor as kind and thoughtful as she is. It's clear she's an amazing social worker and I hope I will be able to impact my future clients the way that she does.
Andrea is amazing! She is always available for questions, and is so passionate about social work.

Andrea is both my advisor and my 1100 professor and she is amazing. She is so caring and has helped me with so many things that I would get a headache trying to count. She is a great person and really cares about students. Take her if you have the chance!

I have never met someone as caring and empathetic as Andrea. She is truly a champion of her students and wants nothing more than for us to succeed and go on to become fantastic social workers. I'll carry what I learned this semester with me for the rest of my life. If you ever have the chance to take a class with her, absolutely do it.

I adore Andrea. She gives clear lectures and is always willing to rephrase something or answer questions to clarify. Always participate in her class! She's an easy and fair grader. She is very obviously liberal and is incredibly vocal about her political opinions (I took her class during an election year), so be prepared for it if that bothers you.
She is awesome & this has been my favorite class of college. She actually helps you learn & is very kind to her students!
Really great teacher.
Best professor I have ever encountered. Her passion for teaching burns like a wild fire.

Andrea is incredible. If you can get into her class (if it isn't already full) SCHEDULE WITH HER. She is passionate about what she teaches and is always willing to listen to your thoughts and feelings and just cares so much about her students. You need to go to class, but the workload is small. She is hands down the best professor I've ever had.
A phenomenal teacher

Andrea is such a great instructor! I only took her for the Intro to OSU class (basically a free "A") but she is also my advisor and I absolutely love going to meet with her. She has a way of making me feel empowered so that I feel like I can accomplish anything! Life goal: be able to positively impact people the way Andrea does. Highly recommend.

Just had her for my survey course, but it is so easy to see how passionate she is about social work. So optimistic and full of energy also. As she is also an academic adviser, she can help with lots of different things. Really listens to students and tries to help them however she can!
easy teacher. dont be late or miss class- she hates it

I enjoyed this class, but there was a lot of writing, assignments due mostly every week, and a 250-word min on the discussion. I enjoyed the topics, but I was looking for a chill GE for my last semester, and this one was a 50/50
I took her for SOCWORK 1140. The class material was very clear and so was grading. She was a great instructor and I would 10/10 recommend.

These days it's hard to find a prof that cares, but I can say that LaVonda Harrington is someone who does. She often sent out reminders and help when we had difficult ethics problems. I learned so much through her class, and she gave great feedback to my papers and posts. I hope I take more classes with her again!

I have taken her online classes before and she was not like this. In this class, she will grade your papers extremely harshly and take off MANY points but in her comments section, she will only say "great paper." with no feedback as to the grade. Her discussion posts which are only 4 points are longer than any research paper I have ever written.

Even when she was traveling, she made herself available to the best of her ability. She always gave us a heads up before leaving and that she may not be available. Responded to emails promptly and gave excellent feedback.
I enjoyed her class. She wanted honest posts and valued opinions

This online class was really pretty easy and as long as you do your discussion posts you'll get full points on them, she was a pretty easy grader on papers and such as well and gave good feedback on papers. I would definitely take her again.
Easy class
Good class, interesting class or group talks

This class wasn't too bad. She gives helpful feedback. I got the answer wrong in a major assignment and she gave me an A anyway because I had done the work. She pointed out that I was wrong but appreciated that I had made good arguments. There are discussion boards weekly. Two 5 page papers. Two 20 question quizzes. A 50 question final.

Lisa Rhees is just a bad professor. She seems really knowledgeable, and I appreciate being thorough, but dear god. She grades so hard, and she always belittles her students with straight up mean feedback. If you do not write it the exact way she wants, even if the answer is right, she will mark it wrong. Sometimes even when the answer is right.

Classwork is easy but Rhees can have a really nasty attitude. Super boring class, reading off powerpoints. Multiple students have had to contact student advocacy services because she always has favorites and scapegoats, which shows in her grading.
I enjoyed her class, her lectures, and the real life stories she had. Easy grader. Easy quizzes.

Professor Rhees was amazing! She taught in a concise, clear, effective manner. She dialogued with students and answered questions clearly. She was quick to respond to emails and easy to get ahold of. She had a lot of real life experience in the field with greatly enhanced her teaching. I found her very engaging and humorous as well!
Easy class, easy grader, but not crazy Professor Rhees' teaching style. She read off of PowerPoint so the class was super boring. I didn't learn anything from attending her class.

the coolest and funniest person ever - loved hearing her stories and experience in the field. her perspective is very interesting and she tells it how it is. lots of lecture but the quizzes are not bad and if you follow the directions for papers youll be fine.

Overall, professor Rhees is great! She is also hilarious and an easy grader. I would definitely take her for any social work course. You have a group project towards the end of the semester and she helps you a lot during class time.

The class was on zoom because of covid. Lecture was kind of boring, but I enjoyed the larger assignments. I feel like I learned a lot from this class that will be useful in the future. She always has jokes, and students really enjoy this professor. Make sure to show up to class & turn things in ON TIME
had her zoom class bc of covid. Her lectures are great and overall if you pay attention you will get an A.

Lisa is awesome, kind, cares about her students, & gives so much helpful real world information that isnt just about the text book and the check marks, but actually prepares her students for the field.

Lisa seems funny and has great anecdotes and field experience, but she is a stickler when it comes to rules and will give no mercy for assignments or attendance, regardless of reasons (emergencies included).

Took her online class SW 3805, I must admit I did not care for that lecture. It was very dry, boring and easy to become distracted. Not an overall well put together class which makes me question the profession of Social Work and the reason why they are paid very little. Not sure if it's worth pursuing a Master's degree in SW at this point.

Lisa is so funny. She makes a really dry class interesting and light-hearted. There are not a lot of points in the course so do your best on the two papers and group project. Go to class to get the attendance points! I highly recommend her and am planning to schedule again with her in the future.

For most part easy grader. There was a semester long group project with presentation, participation is key to getting all the points. No textbook even though the course says to get one, I never bought it nor needed it.  Lisa gives great feedback in the classroom and uses real life practical situations as examples which is helpful. Would recommend!

Rhees is such an awesome prof! We call her Ellen because she's so energetic and makes the students laugh. She knows what she's talking about and sincerely cares that each of her students learns as much as possible. She's an easy grader and quick to praise people publicly. Didn't even crack the book open at all. Definitely recommend her!

I highly recommend Lisa Rhees if all possible .  She was a fantastic instructor who shows true passion for social work and dedication to her students growth.  He course was clearly presented which made it easy to stay on track. Her class has is now on the list of one of my favorite courses taken.

Lisa was awesome! She is a social worker who is really active in the field and you can tell how much she loves teaching. She has real stories and encourages her students to think BIG. I'm going to try to take as many classes of hers as possible, she is awesome.
Awful.  She was the absolute worse professor that I have ever had

She is knowledgeable but I wont take her again unless I have to. You teach yourself. You do the paper and research alone which would be fine if it wasn't a foundational course.  The class was synchronous for NO REASON. It's all paper discussions that could be emails or quick video explanations. Redundant questions and weird paper layout but w.e

I didn't have a good experience with her, for an assignment we had to pick a topic, I picked child welfare. She literally wrote back saying she was an expert in that field and that there wasn't anything wrong with system and it didn't need reformed. I felt completely screwed for the final project because she never taught us that specific content.

wouldn't recommend, questions were referred to the book. It was awful, especially since our graduation was riding on this class. Fellow peers had professors that weren't as particular, the entire class was anxiety inducing.

Dr. Toler is truly amazing! She really cares about her students! No classes the weeks of quizzes or papers so that you can use class time to get it done. So, participation is a necessity. Gave us study guides for quizzes which were super helpful. One group project but you were graded on your own effort, not the group's. 10/10 would recommend.

Dr. Toler was not prepared, gave contradicting information/instruction during live classes as well as on an individual level regarding multiple assignments. Multiple students shared experiences of misguidance and miscommunication with Dr. Toler. I will not take another class with Dr. Toler nor would I advise other students to do so.

This class was taken online and it definitely is a lot of reading but the professor grades fairly easy. To be honest, since this was an online course, I really didn't get to know the professor that well but she always wrote comments on our discussions and really allowed us to learn the material. She seems like a really sweet lady!

The people (students) at Mansfield OSU gave her a hard time and I truly believe it was because she was a black woman. She's a solid choice, extremely easy classes with easy tasks. There should be no reason anyone should receive anything less than an A-

Makes an online class unnecessarily hard and isn't nice when responding to emails. More work than I've had in literally any other class which is insane considering this is a GE. Expects you to read 20 articles a week + 3 long lecture modules, 2 discussions, a quiz, and a project almost every week. Definitely would not take a class with her again.

Abigail really cares about sex therapy and makes the class content engaging and entertaining. She makes the classroom collaborative and a good learning environment. She uses a variety of mediums to keep the class interesting. Mainly a lecture and focused class with a midterm paper and final presentation. Would def take another class with Abigail!
Great professor! Quizzes are easy as long as you use the study guide to help you. She is very clear with her instructions follows syllabus and uses discussion posts for most of the assignments.

Class requires an excessive amount of reading (100-200 pages per week) and quizzes ask about very specific points. Repeatedly states that criminal justice majors will never be good child welfare professionals, which seems weird. However, class is very informative and instructor is knowledgeable.

This was the first class I have taken during my undergraduate and professional degree years where I have felt intentionally retraumatized. Examples that professor Pfile requires are deeply personal and demonstrate little regard for those who have had traumatic experiences.

Very knowledgeable about our child welfare system. Ashlee has been in the field for many years and brings current knowledge and understanding into her lectures. This was her first year teaching so she still has a lot to develop in regards to both classes. I would definitely take another class with Ms. Pfile.

If you are a grad student and looking for an easy A: take! If you actually want to learn and struggle sitting thru uninteresting 3 hour lectures: do not take! The lectures were slow and included slideshows of 100+ slides with a ton of useless information. However, she brought in a few guest lecturers that kept things more interesting. Easy grader.

I had the pleasure of taking Professor Fraley's class this semester, and I can't recommend them enough! Not only is he extremely knowledgeable and passionate about the subject, but they also truly care about their students. They are approachable, understanding, and always willing to go the extra mile to help you succeed.

Take this class!
The best professor I've had at OSU. Very in touch with his students. Makes content relatable, practical, and interesting.

Professor Fraley is an excellent professor. He is knowledgeable, helpful, understanding, and flexible. If you communicate with him he will do what he can to accommodate any unforeseen events etc. He cares more that you are able to learn what you need to learn than if you do everything perfectly.

TJ is a great teacher and a talented social worker. He wants all his students to do well and develop solid projects. I'm happy he was part of my education experience because he has a lot to teach from his career.

He is a knowledgeable professor. His powerpoints are great and he is receptive to feedback about classroom instruction. He uses real life examples and does helpful role playing in class- you feel like you actually learn about therapy practices. Attendance matters, and there are only 2 papers and a test but he grades fair.
He was a good and fair teacher

Professor Foster was great! She held an optional Zoom at the beginning of the course for us to chat, so it was nice to meet her. I've taken MI classes before, but I learned much more in this class. The assignments were relevant and helped me grow my MI skills. I learned a lot of new MI techniques that I will definitely want to use when I graduate.

The most lovely woman ever and the greatest professor I have ever had. 3501 can be overwhelming because there is so much classmate interaction but she is so patient and understanding of students' different learning styles. TAKE HER! I truly don't think there is a better professor to teach this course.

Genuinely cares a lot about teaching and helping her students. Understanding, fair grader, and somewhat picky on different assignments, but is mostly clear on grading criteria and what she expects from you on assignments.

Engages in mindfulness exercises (which helps some people but not others). Constant interaction with classmates, lots of useful hands-on practice. Knowledgeable and helpful. Works full-time out in the field: applicable experience. Shows informational videos; lectures are great. Only a few assignments, but they're easy. I didn't purchase a textbook.

Professor Moreland saved my academic life, I was failing her class and she reached out personally to give me extensions on everything and made sure I got an A. I can't thank her enough for believing in me, she deserves more than five stars. Such a kind and authentic person and a great teacher.

Great professor & person. Has a lot of experience in Social Work & gives real examples+perspectives. Doesn't force talking in class. Great/important class for anyone. Quizzes and assignments are given through the department, but she does offer helpful reviews and extra credit. Weekly chapter reading, 4 quizzes, and a few papers. Highly recommend!!
Just pick another professor if you have to take this class.

Geneva is def not a professor who cares. She doesn't grade papers at all, I reached out to her and heard back over a week later about receiving grades, graded 3 assignments after week 7 of the class, and then disappeared again and graded nothing else. I have also reached out to her about upcoming assignments and she does not answer.

This professor disappeared for months. I cannot they pay her. Had a general explanation for her lack of grading. Then at the end of the semester see was so far behind she did not have time to review correctionss made to prior papers. Terrible PROFESSOR! I would not recommend this person as a babysitter let alone a teacher!

This professor should have excused herself from the class. At one point she was three months behind in grading. Kept giving excuses like a high school student... personal issue's, personal conflicts, unforseen delimia's. I am a master's student and this was the worst professor I have had my entire educational career. STEER CLEAR OF THIS LADY!

I read the reviews before selecting Prof. Sanford for my instructor. I was hoping for more involvement in the class and better feedback from the work assigned. What I was left with was little to no feedback on assignments that took months to grade. Without having an opportunity to improve and correct, I found my grades suffering at her inattention.

Geneva was an okay professor. However her discussion posts were basically full on assignments/papers at times. The course materials were well organized. Geneva Tralee months to grade and disappeared for weeks at a time.
L like that Geneva is an experienced clinician not just an OSU professor. She shares her clinical experiences and professional recommendations. Very good instructor.
Excellent lectures. Solid class.
Danielle has so much one-of-a-kind experience and does an incredible job making macro topics relevant to folks who strongly prefer micro work.

Danielle is a very knowledgable and fun teacher. She really cares about the content and helping students understand the effects of systems on people. Even though it's a macro class, she made it accessible and translatable to micro level work. She was also honest and open about the social work field. I hope I can take a class with Danielle again!

Very caring professor! I know that she is someone I can rely on for the rest of my college career. Her lectures could be confusing sometimes but she brought in a lot of guest speakers that led stimulating conversations.

Danielle is an awesome professor and super knowledgeable. She's understanding of the stress students are under and is flexible if needed. She will challenge you but grades fairly easy even if she  leaves a lot of feedback. HIGHLY recommend

Danielle is a wonderful professor and has made my time in the MSW program much better- I have taken two of her classes. She genuinely cares about her students and wants us to learn, but also wants us to take care of ourselves and lives up to that in practice (unlike some other profs). Learned so much from her and wasn't stressed out by her class!

This by far was the class that made me love my first semester in the MSW program. I have learned so much from her, the speakers she brings in, and my classmates. I appreciate her style of teaching, as she is extremely clear with what she wants in assignments. She also takes feedback every week, and actually changes her approaches based on feedback.

Danielle was amazing. I am usually more micro-focused and this class is very macro, but Danielle has a wealth of knowledge and I learned a lot from her. The assignments were somewhat difficult, but she was very helpful in answering questions. She also offered many (optional) extra credit options.

Professor Smith is a great professor. I enjoyed her, but this was a very macro based class. It was a requirement for my MSW program. I am a micro person, so this community based class was difficult for me. It definitely made me critically think. The papers were intense but I managed! She is great with communication responses!
Angel professor! Choose her, and you will never regret!

Ms. Douherty is a lovely woman. I chose her Social Work 1140 course to meet my GE requirements and had a good experience. She was very responsible; she gave explicit feedback content. During the first week, I missed the deadline for the first assignment due to a course change issue; she offered me an extension without giving me any deduction.

Ms. Doherty is a very interesting woman. Social Work 1140 is an online class. Although I have never met Fiona in person, I can feel that she is an enthusiastic person through the screen. High recommend Fiona!
Very solid professor. Highly recommend to take the course, this is a very easy GE!

Michelle is one of the best professors in the college. She is incredibly smart and knowledgeable about all things social work and she gives great advice. Her classes are interesting and she encourages students to think for themselves and have meaningful discussions. She is so kind and understanding, if you have the chance to take her class, do it.
Dr. Kaiser is amazing and I wish she taught more classes. She is everything a social work professor/social worker should be.
Super nice and understanding. The only hard part of the class was the final paper, but she grades easy on all assignments (including the paper). I just thought the paper was a lot of work.
The best professor! Dr. Kaiser is an absolute pleasure to have as a professor. The kindest and most wholesome professors you'll meet ever.

Michelle is incredibly caring and passionate. She wants everyone to succeed and goes above and beyond to make sure you are cared for. She is very knowledgeable about social work, especially community and social justice, and has great connections in the field. Take a class with her if you have a chance!
Dr. Kaiser is one of the most incredibly professors within OSU's social work department. She is very caring and inspiring. I absolutely recommend her for any classes that she is teaching.

Michelle is one of the sweetest professors, and people, I have ever met. She is so positive and optimistic, and you can really see how much she cares about her students and her line of work. There is not much homework and the textbook readings proved to be totally optional (but super interesting if you have time!), but there is a 10-12 page paper.

Michelle is an outstanding instructor! I truly hope she teaches again in the future. She is one of the very few who knows how to teach and she really does care about your successes especially your grades.

Dr. Kaiser is phenomenal. She won the highest teaching honor at OSU. She inspires students to think and genuinely cares about student well-being. She cares about people. Small Group project and class activities make it interesting and a positive growth opportunity.

Really great and intelligent professor. She is so passionate about social work and has compassion for all people. A really inspirational mentor. Even though you are not a social work major, I still recommend you to take the class. :)

I would never, take one of her classes again! She's super late at grading, I did not have none of my papers graded until the last minute. Second, when she grades its very harsh and she makes up her own rules, you will not have no feedback for the whole semester. There is more but only so little characters to express how bad this teacher is.

Overall my experience was not great, when I asked for help on a paper she just directed me to the module. She grades very slow, which makes it difficult because this class based the major papers off of each other. By the time you got your grade back for the first paper it was too late to change anything for future papers. Her feedback is confusing

DO NOT TAKE ANY CLASSES WITH THIS PROFESSOR! She does not adhere to the rubric and makes up her own rules to deduct points. She is not clear about deductions and just writes lengthy statements that don't make sense. I do not feel I learned anything from her course and just tried to guess what she wanted in assignments to get full credit.

She grades unlike any other grad level professor, docking points in any way she can find to do so. She grades slowly. Her feedback is useless containing long sentences and a bunch of fluff that amounts to no real constructive criticism. I do not feel that I learned anything of value in her class. Avoid at all costs!!

Never gave any real feedback and graded fairly hard. Discussion boards were pointless as you were expected to type 300 words about if you understood a topic. It was hardy to get full points on things you had to fluff to meet the requirements. I don't remember actually learning anything from her or the content she gave us. Mostly google searches.

She is a good professor and she cares about her students. However, the papers are extensive (8-10 pages) and worth little points. In addition, the papers require making graphs and having people fill out surveys and she does not mention this ahead of time, making it easy to fall behind. She is also a VERY slow grader.

She is a weirdly difficult grader, docking points for very minor things compared to other grad level courses. This is compounded by how late she is with posting grades as well as never answering emails in a timely manner. It took over a month to receive grades, which makes it impossible to know how to improve before the next assignment.

Balaswamy is a harsh grader. She also does not respond via email which is hard as she does not provide a lot of detail in the assignments. Often, they are required (strictly) to be x pages long, but she only prompts you for 1/2 the required length. When you receive your “feedback” after grading, she highlights and leaves minimal comments

DO NOT take any courses taught by Professor Balaswamy. I emailed her two weeks before the start of the semester because the required textbooks information was not yet posted and she responded 2 MONTHS LATER. This professor does not provide clear instructions, does not grade assignments within a timely manner, nor does she provide feedback.

This professor was extremely difficult to get ahold of. I emailed her twice over the course of the semester & never heard back. Her papers are really long but worth not a lot of points, and she takes points off for reasons that weren't even on the rubric. I ended up with an A in the course, but my experience with this professor was NOT a good one.

I would not suggest taking her. She is horrid at responding to emails, does not have clear guidelines for what she wants on assignments, and is a tough grader based on her unconveyed expectations. I did take her online which makes communication even worse. She does not send out the same announcements for each section which leaves out info for some.

Graded tough with little to no explanation for the grade. Felt like she expected something totally different than what the rubric and instructions outlined. First class she taught online and she was very confused about the online content. Live session and discussions irrelevant to learning the material and subjects for major papers.

She is a good instructor. You must follow the grading criteria to a t. She isn't the best at always getting back to her students regarding emails. Her papers are long and worth very little points. There aren't many points in the class, so you need them all to get a good grade. Overall, she is good, you just have to put in the time and effort.

The absolute worst professor I have encountered in all my 16 plus years of schooling. Very unreasonable, does not appear to care about students. Incapable it seems to place the need of students as a concern. Very thin skinned and judgmental. Do not I repeat do not take her if you can avoid it. Save yourself the headache.
No one ever knew what was going on. I got the worse grade of my school career in this class because it was so disorganized. I walked away not really learning much.

Balaswamy is very good at what she does (research) and it's obvious that she loves doing it. :) However, I think she's so good at reasearch that she has a hard time explaining the basics to people who aren't good at it. I did pretty well in her class and usually enjoyed the lectures, but I know many had difficulty.
Avoid her. Shes confuses herself

She is very difficult to understand and not because of her accent. She talks in circles and is very difficult to follow- she also does this when you ask questions. She is a hard grader and her expectations are unclear. If you try to approach her after class she tells you to e-mail her and then doesn't reply. Quizzes are very difficult.

I could write a book of examples of her gaslighting, demeaning language, and poor instruction but only have 350 characters. Refused to unlock key material to reference for the beginning of a semester project. Was unavailable. If you have learning disability avoid, she gives you less resources than everyone else gets at baseline. AVOID DR B.

Professor B is one of the most knowledgeable academics in the field of aging and health. Sometimes the lectures can seem a little long, but 3 hours in any class is a little long. She is actually a very interesting woman, and she is enthusiastic regarding students who seem interested in the subject.

I will never take a class with her again!!! Her lectures are unclear and demeaning. She is very unwilling to help students. I asked a follow-up question in class and she told me "Go home and learn it." I asked if it was possible for her to meet after 5 and she bluntly just said "No." She is unhelpful, unaccommodating, and UNCLEAR!!

She is very unclear about what she wants for each assignment. The carmen website for the class is awful because there are old links that no longer work but don't get corrected.  Her lectures don't help you with your assignments. All I can say is choose another section if you can.

This teacher talked to you like a child. Quite contradictory in message and made students feel stupid if they weren't following her thought process.
