Hard to follow big picture concepts because the lecture was tedious.. I met with this teacher for 2.5 hours and she would not accept feedback or the need to self reflect. DON'T DO IT!!

Shes impossible to understand and its not just the language barrier. She is constantly contradicting herself and not paying attention to the larger concepts a research required class needs to be focused on. She takes off points of small errors and decides to give pop quizzes without sharing what they will be over and notes we took weeks ago.
Don't do it!!!!
do not take this class. It is a disaster

RUN!Don't take this course. I didn't take my classmates advice to drop her class & I should have. Her class is absolutely miserable. She is not competent on the subject, she is very authoritarian, treats her students as children, unbearably bland, she teaches skills she is not capable of  performing, she is close minded, reads of lists & ect!

Very boring lectures. Hard to get ahold of and get to return emails. She made up her own grading scale for the class and never told anyone about it until after final grades were turned in. She refused to provide feedback on our final assignments. I would recommend not taking any class with her.

Very enthusiastic about topic, but all over the place when lecturing. Always lectured beyond class time. I attended all her classes between working full-time.  Had to leave early one time to return to work.  As a result, she dropped my attendance grade which reduced my grade one whole letter.  Very punitive.

I had her for the International Ageing Seminar. She is a very nice woman and literally knows everything about this subject and is very passionate about it. I was never into ageing so this wasn't my cup of tea to begin with. There is no book which is nice. Only 2 grades (group presentation and final paper). Class is so long and boring
I hated every moment of her class.

This prof is a nut job--she cannot teach worth a lick--she announced day one that she was not into teaching this qtr (fall 08) because she had a large research project going on--she can't present material at all and changed the assignments every week and NEVER had her office hours and refused to answer emails or phone calls.  AVOID HER!

This instructor is truly a nice person, but just not a good teacher. She is obviously very accomplished and knows a thing or two about research, as she shares in class, but is not clear about objectives, presenting information, or assignment expectations. She has a great sense of humor- but just not cut out for teaching.

While Dr. Balaswamy is a nice person and very intelligent, she is a HORRIBLE professor.  Be prepared to NEVER know what you are supposed to be doing.  When asking a question about a quiz, she literally told a student, "if you choose the right answer, you will get it correct, if you choose the wrong one you'll get it wrong.  Do you understand?"
Did not answer questions in class.   Online quizzes were not on material from class.  She did not want to grade quizzes.
Very good, patient, humorous, interested in student success
very unclear about expections of students, hard to understand
Hard to understand. She is a very smart woman who has a hard time "dummying" things down to student's level. She is a nice person but not great for a teacher. Makes very hard quizzes.

Terrible with clarity of assignments. Even when you think you are following the assignment exactly be prepared for 1/2 credit or worse. I am a 3.5 student and recieve less than half credit on almost all of her papers. Completely boring class. one girl in my class constantly describes her as a nightmare. i think that sums it up.
very difficult, unclear expectations, very disappointed with class and grade!
hard grader, not very clear on requirements. if you become friendly with her shes much more willing to help you out. follow guidelines EXACTLY to get a good grade.
She will, and she means it, dock you a letter grade for missing two classes.  Do you want her for a teacher?
she is a very hard, but she wants you to think for yourself which is a plus. she is helpful and wants to help you succeed!
She is a very tough teacher.  She grades hard and isn't very understanding.  She is a bit intimidating, so student's don't like to ask for help.
Some of the projects were very time intensive but the material was very engaging and

Professor Estes seemed to really care about his students. I was able to get in contact with him easily, and he was willing to give guidance and feedback on assignments. I really enjoyed his class. Just follow the rubric and you will do just fine.

7 total grades, 8 if you count the extra credit. 4 discussion posts (easy), a essay quiz, a media presentation, and a paper about interventions. A little picky and would deduct points if the topic is addressed, but not enough. The main issue is that having only a few assignments was very stressful since if you do bad on 1 you basically are doomed.

She was a decent professor and graded things in a decent time. The final essay was actually interesting, but didn't take into consideration that all the video choices she offered were old enough to where most streaming services makes you pay for them (90%). Not really a tough grader at all.

Carole is very sweet but it will take her a long time to respond to emails. I took class 6401 Evidence Based Practice and when it comes to stats, you'll have to do a lot of external reading. Slow to grade. Nice but I have no clue if she's a tough grader or not. A few assignments are worth a lot. Remember to put PICO in a graph! FOLLOW THE RUBRIC

*4502: Carole is very engaging and so fun to be in class with. She made me actually look forward to an 8 AM. She does a lot of activities and not much book work, but the activities tie in and make it easier to understand the coursework. As long as you come in with an open mind, you'll love her.

Carole is a very friendly professor and appears to be very understanding of our struggles as students. I did not always understand how the material we were covering was related to the topic of the course itself, but it was usually engaging.

Dr. Harvey is really engaging and knows so much about the field! She cares about her students, and I learned a lot from her in a short amount of time. There's a lot of participation in in-person class, but Dr. Harvey makes it fun and easy.

I had Carole post-Covid for an in-person class. Carole is an overall friendly and warm person but she makes learning engaging and hands-on. We did a lot of small group work and class discussions. Carole is very open for questions and provides feedback. The class isn't "easy" but she makes research easier to understand and apply.

Carole is the only reason I have not dropped out. I have not been liking my time at OSU, but because of Carole, I feel like I should stay motivated. She is kind, caring, and passionate about serving people. There are a lot of papers in this class, but that is because the university requires it. Carole can make dry subjects engaging

I took her for one of the drug classes for the substance misuse minor. I did not care for her then because it was too easy. However, for 7401 which is a research class, she is horrible. I did not learn a thing. None of the material taught made sense. Do not pick her for a research class you won't learn. It's time she retires, respectfully.

Carole knows her stuff but is hilarious & humble. Did a semester long group project but she walked the class through the process, so was the most painless group project ever. Focused as much on the group's process and what we learned about ourselves as she did on content. Learned a LOT: about juvenile systems, group dynamics, myself.

She is not so much a research-evidence type of lecturer. A lot of the material was ran through and hard to understand. She would have to layout the material and use the assignments as reflections in order to improve the lessons. Material was confusing and taught really fast. Evidence is not her strongest area.

She was very sweet and passionate about the subject. She done an awesome job by connecting the community with classroom engagement. Very open to help at any given moment. She doesn't really require attendance but it is important to come to class.

She stopped grading at week 6 and contradicted other professors on what are proper terms to use. She also grades with sarcasm, but the quizzes and weekly modules were easy. She's just one of those online professors that don't bother to grade professionally. Also grading on essay's are mostly clear, not fully.

Mitzi is an amazing professor. I took both evaluation classes 7401 and 7402 with her. The class is difficult because of the research papers. Mitzi is good at providing valuable feedback which is helpful to the main paper and presentation at the end of the semester. She was very responsive.

I took 5015 with Professor Moody, my toughest class this semester. It was a good course and I learned quite a bit, but it was demanding. Each week's reading requirement was easily over 100 pages and sometimes much more. Whatever you do, don't quit reading chapters out of  'The Color of Law.' The final revolves around the book!

Professor Moody did a really great job of making this online class engaging and highly educational! I learned a lot and the class wasn't too hard or unreasonable with assignments. Professor Moody was very engaged and responsive and definitely cared about helping students learn and do well.
Mitzi is a great professor. She is very knowledgeable about working with children from a micro and macro perspective. Her classes are primarily discussion and group work-based.

Mitzi is super kind and helpful. She wants students to really succeed and will give them every opportunity to do so! She made/shared videos to further explain what she was looking for whenever we had a large assignment due, she responded to e-mail promptly and was overall very understanding. I would definitely take a class with her again!

Professor Moody has been one of the best since I started the MSW program. She's responsive and provides tons of resources to help students succeed, including lecture videos, assignment examples, announcements with links to resources, etc. She grades quickly and provides useful feedback. She's an excellent professor!

Professor Negash sends out a weekly email going over the course. She is responsive to email questions and gives great feedback. This is the second class I have taken with her. She gives a perfect score as long as you turn in an assignment and make an effort. Two classes in a row with 100%, and most of the class can say that.

I had Tori for an online asynchronous class. She was responsive to emails, gave great feedback on papers and discussion posts, and gave feedback quickly. She sent out weekly emails that provided context for the week's online module and assignments. I would definitely take a class with Tori again.
Professor Negash is a caring and helpful instructor. She gave great feedback, and I signed up to take another class with her next semester.

Professor Negash was my favorite professor of this semester! She is really sweet, and offers good feedback. Her discussion boards are thorough but she is not very assignment heavy. You can tell she cares about the subject along with her students!
Tori was easy going and very helpful. She did everything possible to help her students succeed. I would definitely take another class with her, hands down.

Tori is a 100/10 teacher. She gives amazing feedback and emails students weekly. She also is very kind about mental health and tells students to take care of themselves often. If you email her, expect a long thoughtful response. You would never get a one-word response. This class has a lot of work but she is always open to helping!

Tori is my favorite professor this semester! She answers emails right away and offers useful feedback. For online classes, course content is pre-determined (I think) but she supplements it with relevant information in the announcements. She grades quickly and makes the extra effort to ensure we're prepared for upcoming assignments. She cares!

Tori is a kind professor. The class required a lot of reading but Tori is always accessible if you need help. She reached out twice with anonymous surveys to see how we were doing and it was refreshing to have a professor who values her students for their humanity, not just their academic abilities.

The professor doesn't teach the course. Week after week, the modules lead you along. The only interaction with the professor is through grading. Responses to emails are slow. Some instructions aren't clear, and she doesn't clarify them. I would have preferred a more interactive, interesting, and helpful class. This was a waste of time.

Best teach at OSU so far. AMAZING feedback. Cares a lot. I took 5004 International Social Work. If you care, she cares. Graded fast. Super interesting homework that wasn't too hard. 11/10 would recommend both teacher and class!
This class had a lot of information to go through, and Anna Stewart did a good job presenting it. She answered questions quickly when I had them and gave good feedback.
Professor Stewart was kind, a fair grader, and was willing to listen to feedback from students about grading.

Professor Stewart showed a lot of grace and compassion towards her students. She regularly sent out emails checking in with students, and allowing for extensions when needed. Assignments aren't hard if you follow the guidelines!

Felt like this class had a ton of reading and a lot of assignments. Hard to balance all the work with other classes. She was accessible and provided good feedback. No issues with her as a teacher. I enjoyed her and the live sessions were helpful.
This was a great class and I feel like I learned aspects of international social work I had never considered before.
She is great professor and I adore her. All discussion, two paper and one midterm/final.

I have taken two classes with professor Karandikar and loved both of them! Human Trafficking and International Social Work. She has lots of great experience to teach from, is very communicative with students, is not a super tough grader, and I love the way she formats her online classes. Probably the only online classes I have ever actually enjoyed

Extremely easy course to pass with little to no effort. The entire class is based on weekly readings and a throwaway discussion post. Other than the weekly posts, the only other assignments are two papers that are worth 70% of your overall grade. The first class I've had where I wished effort was actually needed to participate or get a good grade.

Amazing professor AND easy grader! You would truly be doing yourself a disservice if you do not take Sharvari. Lots of reading but you will learn so much. I got a perfect on both papers, the midterm exam, and a near-perfect on the final, and I definitely didn't put in more work than the average student. She's great!
I wish she could teach every social work class. She is a very easy grader. I loved her class.

Class contained a lot of video lectures and documentaries. I did not mind that portion. She was very prompt with feedback and email responses. She was helpful and seemed genuinely interested in helping students learn. 2 papers were 70% of the grade. Luckily she did not grade hard.

Professor was wonderful! Clear expectations and guidelines. One project was optional to be by individual or group which was nice. Enjoyed the assignments given. Great class! Lots of reading but it was good reading.

John really cares about students and helping them learn in a way that works for them. He adapted slides and course content based on what we wanted to learn. He initially comes across as a tough guy persona, but he really cares about students and our learning.

I would recommend taking a course with this professor! He knows the material very well and enjoys teaching students. The only thing I found is that the course material was a little disorganized (information on Canvas was always different from the lecture). Other than that, I would recommend this professor and the class was great!

*The class was SWK7620

It was an absolute pleasure to learn from Professor Provenzano. The content was well presented and organized. The assignment outlines were straightforward and easy to comprehend. I was able to apply concepts to social work by using the course's very practical and concrete examples.

Professor Provenzano is a very caring and accommodating educator. The class was very easy, and he went out of his way to make his class enjoyable even at 8AM. I only used the textbook for the final project. He really wants his students to succeed beyond his class. Accessible outside of class, and great if you need a reference/recommendation letter

John was laid back, but I wish he'd given more feedback related to diagnosing. He gave correct answers but wouldn't explain why other diagnoses were incorrect and why his was right. This class was fine and he was available to answer questions, but according to experiences of others in my cohort, you'll learn more with a different professor

John is a passionate social worker who cares about the course material. He is engaging and charismatic. He has guest presenters come in to change up the pace. Grades fairly. Doesn't assign excessive reading assignments. I highly recommend taking a class with him. His laid back personality allows for the conversations to be relevant to the students.
Jennifer was truly the best professor I've ever had. I  would take her over and over again if possible.

(3501). Jenn is a great professor; you will never meet someone who can explain content as clearly, or a prof who gives as good of feedback. I rated her lower because as a person she can be abrasive even though she's a good prof. It's hard to access her outside of class, and despite this being a personal class, I felt like she was a bit judgy.

She was definitely a nice professor, and she knows a lot. However, she assumes your knowledge is equal to hers and does not go in enough detail. When I asked her a question via email her response was short and condescending. There is not much consistency in her grading and she does not provide clear guidelines as to what she expects on papers.

She is a great professor! She adds lots of videos and links to help besides just reading. Assignments are based solely off material from class and she explains exactly what she wants, easy grader. Doesn't give much detailed feedback, but is willing to explain questions if you have them. This class was online, and she made each week user friendly.

Jennifer is so nice!!! I emailed her a few times for questions and responses were fast and efficient. She gives good feedback on discussions, and all there is to the class is discussions and 4 assignments (1 per month) that are easy. Just get the textbook, its important!
I enjoyed her as a professor. She is fun and knowledgeable. You get a lot from her class but expect to work hard and attend every class.
Good at teaching the material, engaging, grades easy.

This was an online course, substance abuse screening.  This is Jennifer's expertise and it shows.  She is extremely helpful, get the textbook! It helps out quite a bit and a good reference guide.  There were 4 papers, she is a decent grader as long as you show that you learned the material.  Weekly discussion so participation matters. Recommend +++

I heard she was supposed to be great but didn't see that. She is very nice and helpful with students. However, she wavers between being easy and difficult depending on her mood it and isn't clear about what she wants on assignments. Example, on her final she takes off points for things she doesn't state on directions she wants for it. Very flakey.
GREAT professor! She knows her stuff and makes learning interesting and fun. I totally recommend taking her if you can!
Great professor with lots of knowledge and energy!  She kept the class very interesting, and I learned a lot.
Great teacher. Interesting, well-informed, lots of practice in the field. I learned a lot and enjoyed the class.

I took Haywood for Groups class.  She was GREAT!!  She is SO nice and she explains things really well.  She gives great examples that keep the class highly interesting.  She gives very practical lessons and her assignments are great preparation for COMPS. TAKE HER FOR SURE!!
Best professor I've had throughout my college career
she has high standards but she is very caring and understanding. she has a great personality...you will learn a lot!

DSM DIAGNOSIS-HAYWOOD IS ABSOLUTELY THE BEST THING SINCE SLICED BREAD--SHE ROCKS THE CLG OF SOC WORK BY BEING REAL, PRECISE, CHALLENGING, FAIR, FIRM, AND APPROACHABLE. SHE ALWAYS RESPONDS TO INQUIRIES BY PHONE/EMAIL/CLASS--SHE IS ATTENTIVE TO THE NEEDS OF THE STUDENTS AND ALLOWS THEM TO CHALLENGE THEMSELVES--SEEK HER OUT IF YOU WANT TO LEARN & GROW
Great professor. Only gives 2 major writing assignments though, and questions are not very clear.  So be prepared to make those 2 big papers count!!  Overall, fun and interesting professor.
Wonderful professor, very helpful!

She is very nice and is willing to help students.  However, she covers a great deal of material and only gives 2 major assigments, which are writing assigments. So, you only have two opportunties to make a good grade and you have to be able to write well in order to do well in the class. I knew people who struggled because they don't write well.
Great teacher, fun, exciting and keeps things fresh. Good insight and great perspective. Wonderful!
Jennifer Haywood is a good professor.  She brings extra's to her class discussions and she gives thought provoking, exciting assigments based on what is learned in the class.

Qu is an amazing professor! He provide clear and concise instructions. He is also quick to respond to concerns and questions. He grades according to the rubric so as long as you follow instructions and review the rubric you will pass the course. Qu is stylish, handsome and kind and I LOVE that!!!!!!

As a less experienced student in the field, I was so grateful for the detailed feedback. Prof. Helm gave me. I truly felt like I learned so much in her courses (both 5007 & 5008). It was definitely more challenging coming in with limited social work experience, but not impossible.
Linda was one of my most favorite professors at OSU

I have taken her for both 5007 and 5008 (A's in both classes) and she is by far my favorite teacher. She is so caring and sweet and wants her students to pass. She is very clear on what she is looking for in her projects and is always there to answer questions after class. She goes above and beyond for her students. I wish she taught every class.
Dr. Helm is the best. Super knowledgeable and kind!

I absolutely loved having Dr. Helm as a professor. She has so much real-world experience that really helps bring classroom discussions to life. It is clear that she cares about her students, and is very understanding when personal issues arise that could cause work to be turned in a little late. I am so excited to have her again for SOCWORK 5008.

Professor Helm shows a real passion for social work. She is very helpful and understanding. There's many documents to read before classes, but other than that, it's all lectures. There was typically an easy discussion board due every week, which could count as your attendance for the week if you missed the class.

You learn a lot in this class! She grades fair! She expects a lot from you because the class covers serious material! It is well worth your time to take this class if you are interested in children services! Linda is a great teacher!

Online course, child welfare I.  Linda was great! Good feedback, never used the book, weekly discussion so participation matters, there were 4-5 papers, but easy for the most part. Easy A if you apply the material to your papers. Would recommend taking her online or in class!

I absolutely love Linda! She loves what she does and is very knowledgable. She makes sure you understand the material and the assignments. She is absolutely hilarious and always talks about her granddaughter. I'm taking her next semester. Loved this class.

Not the toughest grader if you do things according to the rubric. However, she assigns an absolutely excessive amount of reading weekly. This is often coupled with a documentary or videos. If one were to actually do all the required reading and video watching, it would probably take several hours.

Prof. Washington is a wonderful professor who I appreciate very much. Let me just say I am not the easiest student to have because I have accommodations with the disability resource center which often means there is a lot of confusion on deadlines (because of me). She made exceptions when she did not need to. Really generous of her!

Be prepared for VERY passive aggressive comments about your work. She responds to your opinions that disagree with hers and gives no parameters as to why she is disappointed in you. Group work is excessive- especially when online.

Dr. Curtis is very knowledgable in this field, but she does not have the skills needed to be an educator. She is a strict grader and does not set expectations for the class, and then will post passive aggressive announcements stating she is disappointed because the whole class failed to meet her expectations. Do not take her if you can avoid.

She is intelligent but a poor communicator. Only 3 assignments (2-pg paper & 2 exams) but be prepared to read (syllabus has 5 pg bibliography). She talks in circles and references her own publication (required). Have no idea what course objectives were. Learned nothing but that she seemed to have her own agenda & to avoid taking again.

We only had three assignemnts in the class and 2 were exams that were very unclear in terms of expectations. We only went over 1/2 of the material in class that we were tested on. She is very intelligent but talks in lengthy circles and the structure of class and lectures is incredibly confusing.

Carla is a wonderful person, but I can't say that I learned anything in her Policy Analysis course, and I attended all the classes except for one. Also, it's hard for a group of 5 to 6 to write a 2 to 3 page limit paper collaboratively. Especially if you have different viewpoints with one another.

She is knowledgable and incredibly informative. Her lecture's are interesting as she really knows what she's talking about. She grades papers very tough, but gives other projects to cushion the grade. I've heard mixed things on willingness to help..

Very kind, knowledgable, flexible with attendance, and interested in students success and feedback. Her lectures are very confusing though. It sounds like she almost tries to be wordy, very abstract and doesn't speak directly to the point. Powerpoints are not very clean. The assignments and tests were simple.
It was ok.
Carla has a wealth of knowledge about child welfare and working with youth and families. She expects excellence and carries herself gracefully. I enjoyed the class!

I love Dr. Curtis. Textbook use is fairly high,although it is not really necessary - she can be a little scattered in her thoughts and reading the book helps to make everything fit together. Her assignments take a bit of time outside of class (and she does not use carmen) but i found it manageable with a full time and 2 other classes.

It was clear that Carla is an incredible intelligent and knowledgeable woman but it did NOT translate to good professor. Her lectures were disjointed and baffling. Class lectures, readings and assignmements had NOTHING to do with each other. UGH! You don't have to read...at all. I put in minimal effort and got an A though (shrug).

She's a nice lady, but she does not know how to organize information and teach it. Lecture is ridiculously boring, textbook is dry and never used, and she grades easy on one thing then hard on the next. If you actually want to learn, do not take her.

What I liked most about professor Curtis was how much she cared about feedback. She really wanted student input on the class.  In addition, it was great that she did not push any particular political view, since this aided in class discussions. I learned the most from the class discussions, and the papers. Thanks Carla!

Professor Curtis is a nice person who obviously knows a lot about policy. BUT her lectures are truly incomprehensible.  She talks in circles and uses abstract thoughts way too much.  The grading was fine and the final wasn't too bad, but the class itself was so frustrating!  Any learning was done by reading the text.

Dr. Curtis is a very interesting and intelligent woman.  Class is very unstructured, and assignments are time consuming.  She keeps the class interesting though and doesn't grade too hard.  I loved having her as a professor!!
Class was extremely interesting. I learned a great deal from Dr. Curtis. She is very knowledgable and encourages lots of conversation.
She doesn't grade very hard, but her class was just sort of useless.

insufferable and ruthless. not flexible with due dates even with extenuating circumstances. condescending and strict when grading. will take off major points for minor errors like grammar even if you get the major concept and purpose correct. buy the textbooks and read all the reading material. It will be mentioned and used in discussion posts.
Easy course overall just professor is really picky when it comes to grading. Takes points off for smalles things when overall aspect is correct.
Brian is a great person and it is clear he is dedicated to the field of social work. He also guided very stimulating conversations. I would recommend him!

Yitong was absolutely amazing! I really appreciate her for such a wonderful class. She was so kind and supportive, remembered all aspects of each of us, and truly wanted us to succeed. I have never seen a professor care this much about their students and invest in their students' success. We were so lucky to have her. 10/10 for Yitong's class!!!
She was great. Communicated clearly and was very quick to respond to questions and emails. Discussions were engaging. I like her personalized feedback on every assignment.

Professor Yitong was absolutely amazing! In my three semesters at OSU, professor Yitong is by far the kindest, clearest, and most caring and responsive instructor I've had. You can tell from her weekly announcements and feedback she wants her students to succeed. I really enjoyed the class--super informative! Highly commend her to other students.

Keith was wonderful 6201 and taking him again this semester. He ensures his students understand the material and heavily encourages students to reach out any time for clarification. He's open to Zoom meets that best fits your schedule. He gives lengthy but valuable feedback. Keith is also very supportive and inspirational and is an easy grader!
Disrespectful towards students. Lacked self awareness in 99% of interactions.

Digresses with irrelevant information. Instructions/expectations unclear. Reflects on his own privilege, minimizing student experiences/goals/challenges. Tells us grades don't matter "in the real world." As professional adults, this is extremely condescending. Our grades matter to us. Our experiences are real. We've been living in the real world.
Dr. Warren's teaching style and apparent subject knowledge facilitated our understanding of topic principles and how we can apply them in our practices.

Keith polarizes people. He is eccentric. Keith knows the material and engages with students. He will go over the readings. He does struggle with grading. Organization is not his strength. He will give you feedback. It will be negative. He is always available for meetings. Take advantage of that. He looks out for his student's mental health.

I went into classes forewarned about his teaching style, & was surprised by how much I enjoyed them! He genuinely cares about students & wants us to think critically. Assigned readings could be dense, but ultimately helpful. If you need structure and hand-holding, he's not for you, but his passion is contagious. He's fair & knows his stuff.

Kind, knowledgable, great researcher, very interested in student feedbackinput, flexible class structure, understanding, big on group projects & occasional pop-quizzes. Likes to talk- don't ask a question if you're in a hurry. Not a great lecturer, occasionally condescending & very horrible at timely grading of assignments. Grading seems abstract

The only grade you will receive is at the end of the course, and you will have only learned about his life, friends, opinions, and experiences. I retained nothing about SocialEconomic Justice, even though I readcompleted nearly every assignment and attended every single class meeting. This was very disappointing.

Wow, where do I begin with this? Does not describe assignments at all then expects you to know what he wants. His lectures consist only of him talking about himself for about 3 hours and his opinions on  government issues. Has no grading scale and how he came with my grade I have no idea because he never actually gave me a grade on anything.

Dr. warren is a very good person.! He tries his best to make research fun and interesting in his own way without getting too technical! He is fair and honest. If you have any trouble with anything all you would have to do would be to schedule an appointment during his office hours. He would spend all day helping students if he could.

He is by far the most patronizing instructor I had at OSU. He likes to say, "I don't usually share this because it may be too abstract of a concept for you guys." Yes, our little college student brains can't grasp his big ideas.Take someone who will actually respect you, and just let him do research alone.

Since there was a semester switch its a reworked class. Don't believe other comments. He says "um" a lot but there were no pop quizzes. Really has your best interest at heart and is very understandable, mostly b/c of sem. change. Has you figure out your problems yourself and doesn't give an answer of what to fix. That was the only frustrating part

EXCELLENT PROFESSOR!!!  I am one that has had challenges with math and had great discomfort just thinking about Stats, however Dr. Warren made it pleasant and actually awaken a new respect for the usefulness of stats in the area of social work.  If you can schedule with this professor, God must like you.  Also, he has a nice, warm personality too.

I DROPPED IT B/C OF THIS GUY! HE IS SO FAR OUT THERE-SENT OUT AN EMAIL OVER SP BRK 09 TO BE READ UP ON ALL THAT HE ASSIGNED FOR DAY 1 B/C HE FLIPS A FREAKIN' COIN TO DETERMINE IF THERE IS A QUIZ OR NOT EVERY CLASS-HE CANNOT FOCUS ON ANYTHING-LECTURES ARE SO DISJOINTED AND FRACTURED-HE SAID IF YOU DON'T LIKE IT GO TO THE DEAN WHO CAN'T IMPACT TENURE
Good, gets off topic sometimes, but very helpful and understanding.  Tries to make it interesting
He is a teacher who truly cares for his students. He sets up the class so thats its impossible to fail as long as you make an effort. The class is hard, but he will try hard to help you understand.
great teacher and person.

Any teacher that can make stats fun, and a third installment of human development interesting is worth recommending.  He makes you think about things in different ways, and encourages free thought.  Highly recommend!!!
class is difficult but he is willing to help you out. impossible to fail. take math 148 beforehand if you can, it makes the class like a cakewalk.
wonderfule teacher. his class is hard, but he will not let you fail as long as you try. he is great to talk to outside of class as well!!
Nice guy.  Difficult class
he speaks in circles and very rarely actually makes a point.  he speaks about how grades "don't matter," but is very strict in his grading pattern.

Keith is tough but fair.  If you try at all he wont let you fail.  He cares about the students and will go out of his way to help them.  He cares about the students knowing the info, and doesnt believing in trickery.  Hes a good teacher.
I loved this man!  I don't agree at all with the other poster.  I got an A in his class because I Busted my butt.  Great man with tons of heart.
Really tough does not believe in giving A's even if you work hard.
Fei is solid. participate, read the textbook, stay up to current events, and see Fei if you have any concerns
This is a required class for SW students and I learned a lot from her class. Seriously the sweetest, most caring professor I have ever had. She goes above and beyond to help her students.

She has clear guidance on all the tasks you should finish: textbook, hw, midterm, weekly discussion. This class has taught me a lot of life knowledge. The instructor cares a great deal about her students and had the class well organized. I would recommend taking this class.

Very easy A. Basically you have classwork to read the articles given, discussion post each week, one big paper and then the midterm and that is all. I would definitel recommend taking this class, especially during covid she made this class very easy and she was very easy to reach. The book can be used to learn more, not needed.

She graded me incredibly hard on our first assignment and has been fairly reasonable since then, I'm not sure if that was a show of power or what. Her English isn't great but she assigns mostly readings so that isn't a problem. Answer all questions with a liberal/left worldview to do well! She responds to emails within the day.

The class is Satisfactory/Unsatisfactory so there's some leeway for assignments. As far as Tishia's knowledge, she's an active practitioner and provides good feedback for assignments. She genuinely wants social workers to succeed.

Tishia has 100% been one of my favorite professors at this university. She is so caring and really wants to help her students. I was uncomfortable with Zoom at first because cameras need to be on, and every week we are put into groups. However, I have thoroughly enjoyed this class. I have learned a lot from Tishia, and you should take her classes!!

I took 6501 with Tishia and it was great! You can tell she really cares about her students and wants them to succeed. The grading rubric is very clear and she gives good feedback. I was very pleased with this class. Would highly recommend!

This class was discussion based, attendance is mandatory, easy A if you give an effort. Professor is caring, quick response times to emails, actually wants her students to succeed. No textbook which was great.
Very encouraging to students. I really enjoyed her class and the experience she brought to the class.

Loved this course AND Professor. She grades quickly and if you have technology issues during quizzes, she works with you! This course requires a lot of work, but it beneficial to this line of work. I would highly recommend her! So helpful and quick to reply to messages!
Very respectful of students, excellent communication and feedback. It's a challenging class, but I learned so much! Definite recommend!
Nice professor and easy grader!

Professor Simms is very knowledgeable. He gives great feedback. His online course was easily accessible and easy to follow. His weekly modules are very manageable and quite interesting. He responds pretty quickly and cares about his students!!
Elon is an amazing professor. He creates such an amazing learning environment where you cant help but want to learn.

The class was able to discuss many things in a very open manner. There were several papers and a group project. The great conversations make up for the papers though. He is a easy grader and not strict on APA format.

Elon's class was very interesting. It was an introduction to social work and these classes tend to be 3 hour blocks. He made it bearable by bringing in social workers from the area to talk about their fields instead of lecturing for the whole three hours. He obviously cares, but in my class hardly anyone participated. He tried as much as possible.

Dr. McInroy is knowledgeable in the subject, however she's self-described as not being a practitioner, which is a red-flag for me when studying Social Work. Also, her grading criteria seems to be very unclear and subjective. Lauren is generally accommodating, and seems to be great for research oriented social workers. NOT FOR CLINICAL STUDENTS.

Lauren is an amazing professor and made a dry subject clear and understandable. She is super knowledgeable and you could tell she cared about students and their questions. She never hesitated to re-explain concepts and was approachable inside and outside of class. Such a kind person!

Dr. Mengo is extremely knowledgeable on topics of oppression through violence and coercion, as her research focus is Domestic Violence. Her Human Trafficking class is genuinely one of the most interesting classes I've ever taken. Her assignment expectations differ between undergraduate and graduate students, but she is wonderful.
She is very nice. The lectures are kinda of boring and not very specific, but it is an easy class. She brings in food sometimes!!!!! P.S. she like Tupac

Dr. Lee, or Joyce, is absolutely wonderful. She is accomodating and is willing to work with students who need support. Also, she is engaging and easy to talk to. Joyce is one of those professors who appreciates all of the input from the class. Sometimes, classes run dry, but Joyce is a wonderful person, so it softens the blow of a 3 hour class.

Jeanea was communicative throughout the entire semester through announcements. She also seems to be a fair and easy grader. The Advocacy Project is a bit time consuming, but this seems to be a standard across the college.
Ridiculous turnaround time on grades. 4-6 weeks to get grades back on papers. No responses to emails. Vague instructions with no clarification.

Communication was horrible. I have an assignment from March 4th that hasn't been graded yet and it's almost May... The course has assignments that build on each other (parts 1-4) but you will absolutely not get any grade or feedback by the time the next part is due. When multiple students complained, we all got 20/20 with no feedback the next day..

My favorite professor at OSU! She has so much knowledge beyond what she's teaching. Class is easy, with lots of open conversations and guest speakers. She clearly cares about the mental health of her students. Was not a fast grader, but was an easy grader. I highly recommend taking a class with her!

Prof Upchurch is incredibly caring, knowledgeable, patient, uplifting, and wise. Class was over Zoom, lectures weren't very structured. Takes a while to grade papers but isn't a tough grader. Tip: do the study guide before taking quizzes, and skim readings prior to lectures
Really great teacher and also a great person too.

Didn't learn anything from her. Online class, she was extremely late grading assignments, didn't respond to emails and would accept no late assignments, although she gave herself permission to be late and provided no feedback on assignments. Wasn't engaged in the course at all. Avoid taking courses from this instructor.

Erin is very transparent about her expectations and background as a social worker. The class emphasizes diversity and advocacy, and she really brought her experiences to the table. Participation was key. Erin really connected us to the material and the reality of the social work profession. Always respectful and honest.
Did not learn much class content. She showed up late every class. Takes at least a month to grade papers even though there are only 3 in the semester. Not quick to e-mail back.

This was my favorite during the semester. She offered so many hands on activities that not only help you with future clients but with yourself. This class had weekly podcasts, and book readings but focused heavily on group discussion and experiential practice. She cares deeply about her students and offers personal audio feedback on assignments.

This is one of my first courses in my MSW journey and it was such a wonderful re-entry point for me. Professor Hensley Wessell was a thoughtful, insightful grader and the course material will be useful in my career. I feel like we were asked to read/listen to subject matter that will make us better humans in addition to being better therapists.

Martha is the most caring and attentive professor I have had to date (despite having many great SW profs)! She provides very thorough feedback and offers as much support as needed on an individual basis. I cannot recommend her enough if you want a professor that invests in your success alongside you.

Martha is a fantastic instructor. She provides incredibly detailed feedback and gives thought-provoking insight to class discussions and assignments. I have not had nearly the level of involvement from any professor or instructor at OSU in the past year as compared to Martha. Martha absolutely should teach all SKW 7517 courses in the future.
Cares a lot about teaching and helping her students. Somewhat a tough and picky grader.

Had problems with her from day 1. Her guidelines were vague with harsh grading. In a cohort I'm in she let some students redo assignments but never offered me that privilege even after I inquired about my grade!  Poor ethics! I would have withdrew but they said it was too late in the semester and I would've been assigned a grade regardless.!!!!!
Not understanding of students going through difficult times.
One of the best professors that I have ever had at OSU. She truly cares about the profession and her students. Absolutely amazing woman.

She was so amazing. I learned the most from this class than any other class I have taken in the social work program. She was clear, fast paced with lots of relevant content. She has good stories and fun classes that keep you entertained and understanding the content. Presentations are fun as well. Just loved this class!

Diana is amazing! She is a wealth of knowledge and she relates course materials to things she has experienced in the field. She surveyed the class the first night and adjusted a module to include what students wanted to learn. Her focus is more on ensuring we learn content than just getting a passing grade.

Dr. Krings is a great professor that is willing to help students out. I took SOCWORK 7550 Community Practice Development with her; she gave great lectures and helped students understand the importance of macro social work practice no matter your interest in the social work field. Assignments were very creative and were graded based on effort.

Professor Krompecher takes DSM material and makes it understandable through lectures and real situations. He is more than willing to extend deadlines so long as you communicate with him. Quizzes were hard, but open DSM and he provides the layout beforehand. He gives great feedback and is a very easy grader.

Dr. Boettcher is a social work legend. Look at all he has accomplished in his career when you have a chance. He was responsive when I needed more information, graded quickly, and explained the material well. I look forward to taking more of his classes.

Professor Boettcher was incredibly kind and caring. He will willing to go the extra mile to help students in any way he could. I appreciated his kind feedback, and ways develop our strengths. As far as grading, just read and follow the rubric carefully and you will be fine. I had no trouble getting an easy 100% in his class.

Even though this was not my favorite class I did enjoy professor Boettcher. I will say he is a tough grader and has clear expectations for assignments. I had a good experience with him but I will say over explaining things in my papers helped tremendously.
Dr. Boettcher is certainly an expert in the field! I really enjoyed learning from him and it is obvious he cares about his students and their careers.

Getting ready to READ! There is an immense amount of reading, but with that it really is all relevant and intuitive.  Lectures can drag on a little bit, but with the reading panels after week 4 it gets more interactive.  Boettcher really knows his stuff. I'm pretty sure he is retired and just does this for fun.  NO TEXTBOOK REQUIRED. Just readings.

Richard is a so-so lecturer He drags on quite a bit and the lectures are not very interesting. There was a LOT of reading required for the class and the exams were entirely based off of that. He is a tough grader and expects you to do every bit of reading that he posts online, but is always willing to help. No textbook was required for the class.

Boettcher is an extremely knowledgeable professor. He is also full of himself. His stuff in Org. Behavior is all you'll need for comps if you're in the administrative track. Both times I took his class he required attendance at events outside of reg. class times. Big deal for me since I commute over an hour to get to school and work full time.

Midterm was ridiculous.  It was multiple choice and sometimes all answers were correct and you had to pick  the best one - sometimes one answer was correct but off by one word.  Alsmost all the questions were trick questions. To me, you lose learning the concept that way.

wonderful man, great class if you are interested in becoming a director or supervisor. very educated and experienced. his midterm was very difficult, however he gives plenty of opportunities to raise your grade. i learned so much from this class, and would take him again if i could. highly recommended!
The previous comment looks like one that the professor wrote! I took a class with him and I did not feel that way at all.

He is a great teacher.  He has a unique teaching style that allows students to demonstrate the knowledge they have learned using their own creativity.  He is very helpful and very brilliant.  He wants to see students succeed and sees learning as more important that grades.
Really cares about her students. Her main goal is making sure students learn. She's also really funny. Textbooks provided through carmenbooks, you can read before or after class.

I really enjoyed Karen's class. She was a pretty easy grader and was able to explain things well in class. She does show a lot of videos but they went along with what we were talking about that day. I had an issue regarding group work and she listened fairly and helped us come to a decision that everyone thought was fair. I would take her again.

This was actually for 3502. I've had Karen in the past and she's a great teacher in person but a horrible teacher online. She gets fairly upset if the class stays quiet for too long despite it being online and the quizzes are overly difficult and tries to confuse you with the questions' wording. Wouldn't take this class ever again.

Karen was ok. I wouldn't recommend taking her class, but I wouldn't say avoid her at all costs either. I don't think she was a very fair grader (took off points for weird/irrelevant things) and many of her lectures were just depressing tangents with a few minutes of the textbook material squeezed in at the end.

Professor Setterlin is a good choice. I took her ethics class online in the summer. I was worried that the class would be tons of work, but it was surprisingly easy. She provides good feedback, really knows her stuff, and is an easy grader.

So i took 6301 , MSW track with Setterlin. She brings the content to life by bringing real life social work practice. I took the class in person, never missed a lecture and most students in my section agreed that she was engaging and went into detail conversation and kept the lecture interactive. Yes, shes a bit specific w/ assignments

Overall, she is ok. Just know you have to come to all her classes, or your grade will drop because its almost 5 points (attendance). Her class time is for LECTURE and VIDEOS! I can say she is also a hard graderand doesnt give much feedback. You have a group project that she introduces week 2.

Whatever you do avoid her at all cost! The biggest regret for this year 2021 was taking her class. She maybe a nice person but her teaching style is judgmental. I get it if her class was difficult but the class isnt difficult shes just overly critical. She grades your comments on another students post, does not respond back in a timely fashion.

I took this class during COVID and she refused to record the sessions on zoom. She give a rubric for assignments but will still doc you points for her personal reasons (that doesnt relate to the rubric or formatting), she asks for opinions then decides not to use the opinions. Extremely had on attendance regardless of cause, extreme cases as well.

The worst teacher I had this semester. Deducts points for things not even in the syllabus or the directions. Takes off points for attendance even if you were there the entire time. Plays a million random videos instead of teaching the class. Talks about her career at cps instead of material for the class. Gives homework during school breaks.

This is my second time taking one of her classes. Karen is a very experienced and respected social worker. She is passionate about social work and caring towards her students. My only complaint is that she will sometimes grade arbitrarily and take off points without much reasoning. Overall, she's not too hard of a grader.

Seemed nice, but watch out. Was the toughest grader I've ever had. Seemed to think there's no such thing as a perfect paper. Requirements were vague and all she did to "help" was repeat or cut/paste directions. Lots of videos with class discussions. Mentioned she worked at CPS for 30 yrs at every class, so heavy focus on child welfare

Class is filled with lecture and movies. Movies could be easily watched at home so it is hard to sit through them in an uncomfortable desk. You have to speak up and ask questions over the general and not so informative lecture. Grades more on grammar than content in papers. Tailor your work to be more child maltreatment focused- was her career

Interesting lectures, plenty of good info. Makes connections between material & real life. Keeps things engaging. TOUGH grader: docked participation points for no apparent reason. Assigned single-spaced paper which confused whole class; she'd "inherited" it, no thought to changing it. Docked points for APA formatted (double-spaced) papers.

Prof. Setterlin has a wealth of experience in macro level social work and is an amazing teachers for students interested in battling systematic issues. She should not be taken for granted. Her class helped me flesh out what change meant, the forms it could take, and the potential paths to get there. I would take this class again if I could!

I'm glad I was able to take another class with Karen! She is funny, understanding, committed, and flexible. She is excellent at providing real-world examples to class concepts. Didn't use the textbook once. A large portion of the grade is from the final group project which is worked on in class almost every week.
Professor cares about her students and is clearly passionate about not only her job on campus but her career in the social work community.
She clearly is passionate about what she does.
Always willing to help and definitely makes things more entertaining. She makes sure everyone is heard & respected. She seems like she would be really good at her job.

Funny, caring, and works full-time in the field, so has lots of applicable experience! Tries to get students to think about multiple perspectives. Not a tough grader. Shows popular movies like I Am Sam to show ethical principles. One group project, but only worth 10pts. Chill in-class group activities. Lectures go by surprisingly quickly!

Karen was awesome. She made everything understandable and as easy as possible. It's an ethics course so it can be dry but she found a way to keep us interested. She also includes pictures of her dogs. Funny person. Not the best with technology.
She provided opportunities for extra credit and really cares about her students. I want to continue to take classes with her! I really enjoyed being in her class.
Grading took a long time. Response to emails was long-weeks. No feedback on weekly modules.

Tiffany Pressley is a wonderful professor! I learned so many assessment and diagnosis skills while in her class and would recommend her course to anyone interested in clinical social work. She's the best!

While Engaging with Evidence was not my favorite topic, I feel Professor Kim did a good job with the course. She was accessible and provided very thorough feedback. She is a strict grader (as in if that discussion board is minimum 200 words, don't only put 199 or she's going to ding you), but I found her to be fair if I stuck to her guidelines.

Online class: She gives thorough feedback and extra helpful material to each students weekly discussion posts! Such an encouraging and kind person. Material was presented clearly and she had 3 live sessions to go over each big assignment, which she did so clearly and had PPTs to refer to later which helped. Clear expectations. Great class!
Worst professor I have ever had. You will regret scheduling with her if you do. Not compassionate or understanding at all.

Painful class. Dr. Kim lectures very slowly & often goes off-topic. Often just goes over material that you already were supposed to have read about in the week's reading. Difficult to understand, not because of accent, but because she doesn't explain things well.
Doctor Kim is not as hard to understand as everyone says. People just enjoy complaining. She is the kindest professor I've had at OSU.
one of the worst instructors. she is very slow, repeats herself a lot, poor teaching qualities, her english is awful, grades hard.
She may be a good teacher and know what she is talking about but you will never know because she is impossible to understand.
Very difficult to understand, class was not organized, used materials that were really out dated, treated students in a demeaning fashion, DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!!
Extremely difficult to understand; on two occasions had wrong information but refused to listen to reason (or proof) to prove she had made a mistake.  Highly recommend finding a different prof.
never stayed on topic. i learned more about her dogs than the subject matter
Class is somewhat unorganized.  I often felt confused in her class.  She is very nice but overall I feel as though I didn't learn much.
No Comments
Very good Prof.  Expects you to work hard, but rewards you accordingly.
Good Professor for Field Ed Prep!
Very considerate of your time and flexible. Willing to work with you as long as you communicate. Interesting class and easy to read information throughout each module. Discussion posts were also easy

Content was interesting if you are interested in mental health disorders, although does not go very in depth (but I also didnt buy the textbook). Tests were sometimes wordy and hard to understand the question being asked, but overall fairly easy (all open note). Paper is graded harshly though. Extra credit was given.
Really inconsiderate as a person and non-empathetic. Do not recommend.

Professor Hechmer is a wonderful person to guide students into Field Placement. She's organized, available to answer questions or provide support, and is very kind. I think the organizational structure of the course is evolving to adapt to online learning and she's available to help in working through the aspects that are unclear.

What everyone said before me is correct. Avoid that professor like a plague. She is very suggestive and does not grade according to the syllabus. You will be docked points not based off what you presented which would be correct 9/10 but based on what she FEELS you could have added on. I barely got an A in this class and I'm an A student,

She does not provide proper material to prepare you for her assignments. She grades you very harshly and does not say how to fix it. Super condescending when you ask questions as if we're supposed to know this information already. When I used the book to help me, she took off points as we're "not supposed to use the book to help" AVOID THIS PROF.

Long and lengthy feedback, but it is always done in a way that points out everything that you did wrong, as opposed to teaching how it is done correctly. Extremely unclear instruction in the course. She then grades these unclear questions based on what she thinks is correct on subjective material.

Dr. Bob is a gem. From day one, he says "I'm excited to learn alongside you". He genuinely wants students to succeed. He has a beautiful way of sandwiching a helpful critique between a beginning and ending praise such that you feel how much he cares about forming a good relationship with you. I've had three classes with him and enjoyed every one!

The professor doesn't really use the website. He didn't add due dates, so make sure(!!!) you add them to your calendar from the syllabus. Class was in-person, all students were female, and he made several creepy comments. Mostly lectured about himself. He's a nice guy but not my style of professor. Maybe his classes are better online.

Wonderful professor ! He is very knowledgeable, gives excellent in depth constructive feedback and very supportive and understands the challenges of being a grad student and working FT. I am currently taking my second course with him.

Bob was AMAZING. I cannot express how great this class was with Bob, it is clear how incredibly passionate and dedicated bob is to his clients, students, and work. He was a personable, caring, insightful, and overall wonderful person. I wish I had more time to take another course with Bob.

Bob was such an incredible professor, especially for someone just starting graduate school. He is very clear about what his expectations are and often begins and ends class with a self care exercise. Bob is an absolutely fantastic professor and you will be lucky to have him as your mentor.

This professor has poor pedagogy. He lectures for hours at a time without having the students do in class activities, loses track of what is he saying in the middle of the stories he tells, and prioritizes telling stories about the most difficult clients he has had over going over the texts, power points, or having students practice skills.

If you ever get the chance to take Bob do it right now! He is one of the best teachers I have had during my MSW. He wants you to pass, will give extra help, funny, and very caring. This class had some bigger projects but he told you everything he was looking for to make it easy to get an A in his class.

Bob is the best professor I have had in my entire educational career. He is an easy grader, but he provides a lot of helpful and encouraging feedback. Not only does Bob tell you he cares about his students, he shows it as well. He's also hilarious. I wish he taught all of my courses because he's a great professor and a great person.

Bob is very understanding and a fun/funny guy. He brings cookies and really cares about his students. Show up, put some thought into assignments and you will pass. This class is also pass/fail. It would be a shame not to take him. He gives plenty of case study examples.

Bob is one of the best professors I have ever had. He is super engaging and gives great feedback. He truly cares about his students. I learned more in his class than any other class because he made it applicable.

Bob always connected the class back to his practice. He is one of the most realistic professors I've had thus far: I came out of his class knowing what to expect in the social work field. He is understanding and genuinely cares about student success. He always kept a 4 hour class interesting and had reasonable expectations for assignments.
Good professor, good class very clear, and you learn something.

Dr. Bob is a gem to the MSW program at OSU. He truly cares for his students and will gently challenge you to continue learning and perfecting your skill. His lectures are inspirational (peppered with real-life stories) and he treats you as a colleague from the very first day. Take any class by this man; you won't regret it.

I love Dr Bob! He genuinely cares about his students and clients. His class is enjoyable and upbeat. He encourages students to interact with one another and get to know each other. He teaches useful integrative mind body spirit interventions that are helpful for clients with practically any diagnosis, and also great for personal use.

Great class! He is a great professor and I will continue to take his classes. I even signed up for an 8am with him next semester because it's worth it! He cares a lot about what he's teaching and his students. I learned so much from his class!

Dr. Ahern is an absolutely wonderful professor who cares passionately about teaching and students.  He values creativity, and encourages students to keep on growing.  His assignments are reasonable, flexible, and can be completed with little to no stress.  Dr. Ahern ties his own life experiences into lectures.  You will want to go to his class.

Professor Ahern is the best teacher I have ever had. He is passionate as well as compassionate, has countless captivating social work stories, and genuinely loves teaching students going into the field. A great resource!!

Bob was the first professor I've had who has ever REALLY held my attention the entire course (which was surprising because our class was ~3.5 hours long!). He was so entertaining and engaging, and his stories always illustrate the lesson he's teaching perfectly. I love the experience and passion he brings to his students! Try to get in his class!!!
Very funny, nice, helpful, and knowledgeable!
He is an amazing teacher.  Extremely passionate and knowledgeable.  I would highly recommend him and take him whenever possible.
Awesome! will take him whenever possible- makes Saturday class enjoyable!
Ahern is a great guy, there is a reason why his classes are always full.  He tells lots of funny/relevant stories and is a fair grader.

Dr Ahern is the best prof!  Take this class for Individual Counseling if at all possible.  He concentrates on CBT to the point where you feel fully capable of actually implementing it!  Also, it's a GREAT prep class for comps. He's highly entertaining and so nice to students!! TAKE HIM!!

Dr Ahern is the best prof I have had so far at OSU.  His lectures are SO applicable and he uses TONS of great examples.  He's funny, flexible, and COMPLETELY understands his students.  He really makes the material applicable to your life.  All students are captivated during class because he's so interesting!  TAKE HIM!!!!

THIS WAS A GRAD LEVEL (MSW I) SPRING 09 CLASS & IT WAS A WASTE OF MY MONEY-IT WAS A JOKE. NICE MAN BUT THE CLASS WAS HIGH SCHOOL CONTENT AND NOT PRACTICAL, RELEVANT, ORGANIZED AND DEFINITELY NOT GRADUATE COURSE WORTHY-AVOID HIM IF YOU WANT TO LEARN-IF YOU'RE JUST IN THERE FOR A GRADE THEN YOU'RE OK-I THOUGHT IT WAS A JOKE W/O A PUNCH LINE-TERRIBLE!

Prof. Meadows, seems more interested in her practice and her PhD and has really very little interest in teaching. She is hard to reach and doesn't respond well. She graded an assignment and when I called her on the grade she admitted not having read the whole assignment clearly and then re-graded. Never taking her class ever again.

Lazy and grades harsh.If you're going to grade so harshly then put in the work for the discussion posts, actually read them, and provide feedback for them as well as the papers we write. This is already a tough program and we really don't need instructors like this. If you don't want to teach, then don't. Avoiding her AT ALL COSTS in the future!!!

Chante talked for long periods of times. A lot of her content felt like review on things I already knew. Very hard to get in touch with her. She did provide multiple extra credit opportunities and brought some cool guest speakers to class to discuss things we wanted to learn about. If you go to class and do the assignments you'll be fine.

If you take any classes with her be ready for her to talk endlessly and put you to sleep. She never answers or responds to emails and has an overall lack of caring for what she teaches. Ask her questions she basically shuts you down and will never fully answer the question. Participation was flaky if she would count it that week or not.

Chante was an okay teacher. She did not do well when preparing students for quizzes. The entire class would have an F. Halfway through she started giving study guides though in order to help. There was A LOT of reading for the class. She wanted students to read chapters 1-7 within the first week of class.

Chante is a very easy grader with an overall lack of structure or direction. She will make up expectations, assignments, and class topics as she goes (even if it doesn't align with the syllabus). If you can handle the unpredictable and sometimes confusing nature of her teaching style, it's worth the easy A.

Chante seemed to be an easy grader as long as you follow the guidelines and rubrics. There were A LOT of readings for this class, but she also arranged to have many guest speakers so you could hear different perspectives.

Almost every discussion required watching a long video and the final project was videotaping ourselves, transcript with reasoning, and a reflection. The lectures were overlapping yet papers required specific techniques. She is also a pretty picky grader and will deduct points if a question is answered, but not enough.

Professors Meadows is a great professor, but if you are looking for detailed feedback and quick return on grades received, seek elsewhere. She delays posting Live Session grades, deducts points without reason, and response time to emails can take a few days. I enjoyed the class, and the assignments, but felt she had other priorities.

Professor Yoon was super helpful and very caring. There are only a few major assignments in SWK5005, but I still felt that getting an A was pretty easy. Her feedback is amazing and well thought out, it is clear she wants to hear what we have to say. I learned a lot in this class, and I think I am walking away better educated. Highly recommend.

*Not the course that I selected it was the only option*  

Prof. Grades quickly, fairly and in a timely manner. I took the course 5005 Human Trafficking. I would for sure take a class from this prof again.
Great instructor
Professor Yoon was very clear with expectations and her grading was fair. Loved her lectures, she really created a fun learning experience that utilized the materials in active ways.
I took this professor for lifespan development class. She was wonderful! She graded accordingly. Her expectations were clearly defined and there was amazing communication and feedback!
Dr. Yoon is a great person but her class was boring. It is difficult for her to think outside of the box. She literally goes by the book. In my opinion she does not have a clear voice.

Dr. Yoon is the sweetest, cutest person you will ever meet. However, if you want to be challenged, choose a different section. The class grade was based on 2 papers and she went over the content in the book in every class. You have to attend class for participation points. This class felt like an undergrad class.

This professor is amazing! She goes above and beyond to help her students. Her lectures are very informative and she really knows what she is talking about. She will help her students anyway possible to make sure they succeed! I would take this professor again and again

She is the absolute best teacher as well as person. Her assignments are appropriate, she gives terrific feedback, and she goes out of her way to make sure her students are getting the best understanding of material. I wish she could teach all of my classes. She is the number one best.
Seriously the sweetest, most caring professor I have ever had. I would take her every semester if I could. Dr. Yoon is the best.

Dr. Yoon is the cutest, sweetest, kindest professor ever. You will not meet a professor who cares more about her students. She goes above and beyond in all areas. She really values student feedback. Her class was a joy to be in every week.

She was literally absent from most of the class. No communication. It took her 7 weeks to grade discussion posts and assignments and it only happened because many of us complained to the department. We had basically no direction for the last assignment and I am not sure if she actually read it or just gave everyone an A. It was the worst class

Lauren is a great person and is very helpful. However, she cannot teach well. I did not learn a thing during the entire 15-16 weeks. It's very irritating and you would be better off taking another professor if you don't have a solid understanding of statistics. However, I am anticipating a B+ to an A- leaving this class.

Lauren is a kind individual; she cares about her students and is always willing to help them. However, despite this there were several negative aspects.   No class structure as everything was on the fly and several assignments completed were never graded. She appeared extremely busy and it affected this class as there was no consistency.

Lauren is very helpful and willing to talk to students when they are in need. It is clear that she really cares about what she is teaching and her students. She is always willing to look over drafts of papers and meet with students outside of class. Very easy to communicate with and getting back to emails on time. I also talked to her on the phone.
I have had Lauren several times now. She is helpful and passionate about what she teaches. She seems grumpier this quarter and has assigned WAAAAY too much work but is still overall a good prof.
She is far and away the best instructor I've had at OSU.

I really enjoyed my synchronous lifespan development class. The PowerPoints were well structured, we had great breakout groups and discussions. She wanted everyone to participate, she grace detailed, helpful feedback and followed the rubric.  and we learned a lot. 
I wish all online classes would be so informative, engaging and fairly graded.

She gave good information and really encouraged participation. She was very good about office hours and would answer questions clearly for understanding. Most professors do not take up the entire 2.75 hours, but she does and sometimes goes over. She is very smart and easy to learn from. She likes your camera ON.
She is seems uneasy all the time, she talks a lot and you will be reading a lot in her class.  She is a picky grader.
Absolutely the most inspirational professor i had while I was at The Ohio State University. Full od compassion and willingness to go above and beyond all teaching levels.

Very nice person. Kinda "hippyish." Lectures easy to follow. Bad thing is she puts everyone in groups EVERY class which isn't my thing. Don't know if it was her or class design but the class was spent more on study strategies than actual preparation for the Social Work exam.
Nice instructor who is really interested in teaching students the foundations of social work. The class is a guaranteed 'A' as long as you put in the effort in the assignments. Two thumbs wayyyy up!

she is a really nice lady and her asides are pretty funny, too. She uses TV shows way too much abut puts all her powerpoint notes on carmen so there is no need to take notes during class. We didn't need the books for the midterm either. She also likes to put people in groups in EVERY class. Impossible to fail unless you just don't turn anything in.

John is great! I took him for 7401 and 7402 and definitely would recommend. He is helpful and spends time teaching students how to use Excel (I don't know how I didn't know how to do Excel after being in both BSSW and MSW). He's honestly great and is na easy grader!!
He talks more about himself then the subject matter.

He is very smart and knows his stuff. He can sorta get off track during his lectures but I still found him interesting and a good teacher. He really does care and wants his students to do well. The class I took him with was research based and I am not a fan so the subject matter was the only thing I did not like.

Dr. Elliott does absolutely everything in his power to help his students succeed. He responds to emails quickly and typically ends his classes early if he has wrapped up the material before the expected end time. I would absolutely recommend Dr. Elliott to anyone taking their social work research courses.

Dr. Elliot is very smart but he is incredibly boring and talks in circles. Don't ask him questions, he will just confuse you more. His class isn't hard but I think his lectures are pointless and I do better trying to teach myself the content with YouTube videos. He is a fair grader and is very understanding.

He could have been a great proffessor. Until he decided that it was an okay thing to all but say that all eastern medicine is fake and not real. He completely disrespected the culture of so many different countries. The fact that he's teaching a social work class is astounding. Never take him as a professor if you want to be a good social worker.
He is great! He explains well and puts a lot of thought of going through the material in the class.
Professor Elliot is great! Always shares personal stories that relate to what you are learning. Even at 8am, his class was engaging. Stats is hard, but he made in manageable!

The class material is essential for any social worker going into the field. Mismanagement of medications impacts micro and macro practices with all populations. Learning Pharamotherapy is difficult but the class is very manageable. Dr. Elliot made a class designed for the students to do well and learn a ton.
The tests can be a little challenging, but if several people go the same problem wrong the he will give the points back to the student. If you do the work its an easy A.
Very intelligant professor, but doesn't explain things so people can understand them. Very monotone and boring!!! Have to read several articles every week and write summaries about them ! Dumb!!!!

He's kind of boring but a total sweetheart. The papers were stressful but actually not that bad once I did them. His lectures are long and unnecessary most of the time. No book assigned, which was nice.

John is a great professor! He provides great feedback, explains projects and assignments very well, has clear grading criteria, not many tests or quizzes, is there for you for feedback or clarification, and really seems interested in helping students succeed. Reading is a bit much, but researchreading. Don't bother buying the textbooks!!

Dad jokes, long/boring lectures, group activities in class which helps the monotony, VERY clear on instruction, responds to emails within 24 hours- usually sooner, helps you in assignments and on papers, truly wants you to learn- NOT just earn a grade, spends time with students, kind man, would definitely recommend him.

Professor Elliott seems like a decent guy, it's just that his lectures are long and didn't seem to help much.  MAKE SURE YOU READ! Taking notes is essential as well! Attendance is not mandatory, but almost essential to passing the course.  It helps if you can motivate yourself and bring a personality to the course.  NO TEXTBOOK REQUIRED.

This was this professor first time teaching, but I think she did a decent job giving not having previous teaching experience.
