There wasn't a lot of work to do in this class, just 3 papers and 4 tests that are majority of your grade. There was some in-class assignments, however nothing that was too complicated.

Amazing professor! Her classes are short and sweet, however very informative, and she will always let class out early if needed rather than waste time. I would definitely take another one of her classes again

Jaclyn is a kind professor who is accommodating to students. She is approachable and incorporates mindfulness into our in-person class. Even though her powerpoints are straight from the textbook they are pretty informative - didn't necessarily have to read the chapters this way.
Wildly boring, few assignments, lack of intrest

tbh i was worried with her other class ratings, but this course this summer was easy, really interesting, and fulfilled a major requirement. she organized the online material well and also gave feedback on assignments (which i liked). 1 paper on a topic of your choosing and then discussion posts.

take the class if you need a credit, i liked her.

My first day class, I salute everyone, she didnt answer me. Every week, I attended the Zoom but she never asked me to participate. She dont mine anything about me, sometimes I think she dont like me at all because Im an black girl thats why. I try to introduce myself and talk to her but she didnt answer me, last time when I ask her help,

This teacher is the worst teacher I have ever experienced in my academic career. I do not recommend her to anyone. If she is the only teacher for the class wait till next semester. Condescending and has many visible unconscious bias for being a social worker. Her lectures are pointless and makes them about herself. Stay away from this teacher.

I don't even know where to start. Among other issues, each week was worse than the previous with her going on about personal stories, biased outlooks on the social work profession and ridiculing students in front of the class. I feel like I learned nothing about the actual topics that we were supposed to cover. A waste of time.

Professor Groh was certainly a challenging instructor and thorough grader. While there were times that I felt put off by her grading, I think it inspired me to work harder and strive to do a better job. Her lectures were interesting and informative with a lot of real world clinical experience.

Look for other options! Sitting for 2.5 hours being read slides and talking about her clients while being talked to like a child. Assignments were easy but completely irrelevant to the class overall. As a senior, this has been my most hated class this far.

Assignments are very disconnected to the course content she covers. She grades as if we should have 10 years of experience already. You can complete an assignment thoroughly and well according to her outlines/rubric and still get a bad grade. Barely goes over assignment criteria, instead has you talk to classmates (who dont grade you) about them.

If all the OSU MSW profs were like Jaclyn I would transfer. Class is listening to her lecture from the text & tell stories about her personal life. Sometimes you do group work but she does not offer input. I can tell you more about her life than what she wants from assignments. Such a disappointing, frustrating class & so much unnecessary stress.

this is one of the most frustrating classes i have ever taken. she grades on very few items, does not give clear feedback, and it seems like she grades on how she feels. her lectures are straight from the textbook and she speaks a lot about herself, but her stories are not helpful. our assignments and class material also do not seem to go together.
The hardest grader I've ever had. It's almost like her grading style depends on how she's feeling that day. Talks a lot about her personal life versus the course content

A few writing assignments are used to determine grades, but her criteria for grading are unclear. She will take points off without providing any suggestions for improvement. Expects students to approach her privately for info she "forgot to cover" when she speaks exclusively about content unrelated to the subject matter for the class

Grades are based on just a few writing assignments but her grading criteria is very unclear. Will take points off without providing any feedback on how to improve. If you want an A in her class you almost have to guess exactly what it is she wants to hear. She spends too much time in lecture talking about herself instead of focusing on the material

three papers, two projects, three SOAP notes and participation. she's the hardest grader I've ever had. she doesn't offer examples for assignments and makes it a point to not answer questions about the rubric until after she's graded (usually citing things that were never required from the rubric to begin with)

4 quizzes that were over very specific things in course modules which was difficult, weekly discussion posts with replies, an easy paper, and a pretty big project due at the end of the semester. this class isn't hard just boring. raiz is super communicative and willing to help in any way, and carmen was organized for an online class!

Class was fairly easy. Weekly discussions were about a paragraph or two, 4 quizzes in total (tests were based off of reading), and a final 20-day reflection. Reading was boring and test questions were on minor details which made them difficult. Professor Raiz was an easy grader on papers and discussions. Boring class but easy A.

I would not suggest taking Professor Raiz class and would recommend taking someone else. She's terrible with email responses and is a tough grader. It seems like she doesn't really care about teaching or helping her students to understand the course material and pass the class.
Good class and easy A

Lisa seems like a good person,  but not a good professor at all. Everything was completely unorganized, right from the very first class. The syllabus changed many times throughout the semester. Group project, no class time to work on it. Took her forever to grade things.

Professor Raiz is a very passionate, well-informed social worker. With that being said, she's a terrible, unorganized instructor who I would have dropped from if her SOC1130 wasn't a prereq for my major.

the class was pretty easy overall, going to lecture is important bc she gives you key information for exams, but even if you miss everything is online.  she's really bad about replying to emails, and even just talking to her after class is difficult.  but other than that she's a great prof!

Very helpful, she definitely wants her students to succeed. Lecture material is very immportant but reading the text will get you by. Sometimes lectures get a little boring, but if you're interested in Social Work this class is super helpful.

This class was a joke.  It was easy to be successful but the lectures were boring and consisted of thiings that most people already know.  Discussions turned into group therapy sessions. Dr. Raiz was not accessible to students, rarely returned emails, and clearly would have rather been back in the field instead of teaching a group of undergrads.

Dr.Raiz was an awesome teacher. She was very down to earth and was very helpful if you were willing to ask her. I really enjoyed this class very interesting and tests were appropriate. Just go to class and you will do fine! She is an excellent teacher-i highly recommend taking her class!!

Her class is a breeze, but to get a good grade you have to go to lecture. She asks questions like, "What did the triangle exercise we did in class demonstrate?", so you really need to be there -- even though most of the lecture is her babbling. Some of her test questions are worded very strangely like she wasn't paying attention when she wrote them

Had her for 230 and she was just fine--class interesting and well organized. Took 695.16 (Phys Health) with her and it was horrible. Not well organized, not interesting, she doesn't return emails and the papers were not fun. Could be bc first quarter teaching it, but would not risk it if you're looking to be stimulated.
fantastic teacher :)
She really cares about the students and what she is teaching.

I loved the way she taught and how she demanded that we participate.  She gets the best out of you by giving so much of herself to the students.  She is firm, fair, reasonable and extremely gifted in the classroom.  She does research and her lectures are real and relevant.  I suggest her to everyone that will listen.  She is amazing and helps a lot

i would suggest this teacher to anyone who likes a challenge. this teacher is very helpful and has a great sense of humor. this teacher is fair and gives everyone a fair chance. this teacher also grades fairly.
She is a really good professor.  She is very knowledgeable and teaches in an easy to understand way.  I would definitely recommend her!

She is one of the BEST professors in the field of Social Work, she is EXTREMELY helpful and down-to-earth, is willing to work with you and set up meeting times with her if you need it.  She embodies what it means to be a "great professor"!!!

Prof. Raiz was a horrible teacher.  She refuses to help students and personally I think she only cares about is her own research and doesn't give teaching much of her time or energy.  I would do anything possible to avoid having her as a teacher.
Very good teacher! Socw 230 is my fav class. It is pretty easy if you read and pay attention in lecture!
Great professor and great class.  Really fun and interesting, not difficult. Tests are very straightforward.
very dedicated to her work and teaching. very easily sidetracked though. great class, i learned a lot!

Amazing teacher! Very interesting and interested in teaching. Lots of energy and lecture was not too boring most of the time. The material covered is really interesting and the class is pretty easy. Loved her!!!
lectures were somewhat boring at times, but she presents a lot of material in an easy to understand way.
She was very kind and helpful. The class was clear and the test reflected both her lectures and the book materials. She was a fair professor.
No Comments
Kept the class interesting.

Very helpful and understanding. Loves what she does. Plus her class is pretty darn easy. Also she is definitely not boring and calls for alot of debate in her class. She lets you say exactly how you feel. Good person as well as teacher.
She is very considerate of all opinions and knows what she is talking about.
has alot to say about things she know little about.
Class is very interesting and she makes it easy to go to lecture. Very easy to understand everything.
She was super nice and understanding about pretty much everything

Professor Song was very organized and informative. I learned a lot in this class. The final project is much easier than it seems. Warning- if you take her class online, discussion board posts are due on Thursdays, and comments are due Saturdays. She sends lots of email reminders to help understand assignments & not fall behind.

Professor is strict about citations and following assignment guidelines. I recommend her to students who want to make the most of their education, not those looking for an easy A. The final project seems like a lot more work than it really is. Just remember to do the reading & pay close attention to directions. Professor is very helpful over email

I thought this would be an easy, intro level GE, online course. We had to read 30-70 pages of a dense social work text book and lecture notes and videos every week. Way to much time for a 2 credit hour course. If you are looking for an easy GE this is not it. Stacy is doing entirely too much.

She's a very tough grader and I took this class online, but it was very hard for me to understand the materials online. You have to put in A LOT of effort.  I always tried my hardest on assignments to the best of my knowledge, but it never seemed to be good enough for full points.

I did not even buy a textbook but still succeeded. She is helpful + understanding of issues. Pretty much gives you the points if you put effort in. Weekly discussion posts, a few small assignments and a large final project. She is one of the academic advisers so she is very accessible on campus. Very passionate about social welfare.

Very Lecture heavy but talks very fast and particular in papers. Grades on a doctorate level. 
Very informational teacher but requires too much. 
Willing to assist but recommends making it to class.

I took Alans class online and it was the worse mistake ever. He was such a harsh grader! Hardest class i've taken at OSU. The criteria for assignments were so specific & hard to find. The majority of the class failed and despite talking to him about my grades he would only add a point. Please spare your mental health and choose someone else.

Hardest class I've taken at OSU. He was such a harsh grader!!! The majority of the class was failing. So many graduating seniors failed the course and were not able to graduate in the spring due to his class. His quizzes were hard. The assignments were so specific. and his critic was not helpful. I tried but his class was mentally draining.

Worst professor ever!! 
Did not give extra credit and was tough as a grader. 
SAVE YOUR MENTAL HEALTH !

I managed a B in this class by sheer willpower and tutoring from someone with a degree in stats. Maybe in person he is better but online was miserable. He did offer some extra credit and chances to redo assignments as much of the class was struggling. He is a tough grader. Make sure you know APA forwards and backwards. Not my first recommendation.

I managed to get a B+ in this class by sheer willpower and tutoring from someone with a degree in stats. It was a tough semester. Maybe in person he is better but online was miserable. He did offer some redos and extra credit which was appreciated since he is a tough grader and a majority of the class was struggling. Would not recommend.

Worst professor ever!! Very disappointed to take this professor, very vague in instructions. 

Cheers

Horrible professor. Very tough grader and instructions on assignments are confusing. Rarely gives extra credit. Very particular on what kinds of research articles should be included in the assignment and if you pick the wrong one you fail the assignment. Would not recommend this professor to anyone.

I was very optimistic about this course since I received a great grade in 3401 and the promising reviews from other students here on RMP. However, this is the WORST professor I have ever had. If you listen to any review on this site, please let it be this one. Save your mental health, your sanity, and will to live. TRUST ME.

A ton of people hate this class, but Prof Davis does a great job with it. He gave lots of extra credit opportunities. The only time I used the textbook was for an extra credit assignment. Take thorough notes of weekly modules and you won't even need to take notes in 3402. Super helpful in emails. Great professor, very caring.

He was incredibly helpful. Fast replier to emails & useful advice. The class was online but he created a weekly optional meeting that he would give extra credit for. Over the course of the semester there were many opportunities for extra credit, which was especially helpful considering this is a class that many social work students struggle with.

Alan is amazing! I could never have imagined that a Stats course could be so easy AND there are soooo many extra credit opportunities. You get extra credit for literally just showing up to the optional meetings. He makes it very easy to get a good grade as long as you try. Very understandable and gives good lecture notes/exam study guides.

Professor simply doesn't seem to care about her students. Has very little involvement with those she 'advises', and every fellow student I've spoken to agrees that it's nigh impossible to get ahold of her. Claims to care about those students who are going through a hard time, then brushes them off like dust on her sleeve. Jealous and catty as well.
professor does not engage with students well, plays favorites, and does not care about her students.
she does not care about her students
Stacey is amazing, she offers tons of feedback, is extremely helpful and is always supportive of any career moves in the future.

This class requires a lot of work outside of the classroom and is very research heavy, but Stacey tries to make it as easy as she can for her students and is so reliable when it comes to answering her student's questions. GO TO CLASS, her lectures are long, but very helpful. She is so kind and fun and I highly recommend her.

Even though it was an online class, there was  no interaction. Grades were submitted weeks late, at best. Almost no feedback. Does not follow her own guidelines in the syllabus. Online lectures were not even done by her. Not really sure what she even did during the semester other than post tons of reading and work.

By far my favorite professor in grad school. I have taken many classes with her and have always enjoyed them. She is timely at grading, gives supportive and helpful feedback and is super available. On top of these great qualities, she is understanding and forgiving which was the best part about having her. I would forever take any class she teaches

Held Zoom office hours weekly; was engaged, answered questions clearly. Posted videos explaining each paper + left timely feedback on assignments. Yes, you work for the grade. It's grad school; that should be the standard. Reading, etc. isn't for a "4 pt. discussion board;" it's to LEARN THINGS, apply them, and become effective social workers.

This professor does ENTIRELY TOO MUCH. Like, 38 pages of reading for a 4-point discussion post too much. In addition to assigning discussion posts that require paper-level amounts of work, she also is a ridiculous grader and nitpicks EVERYTHING. You will lose half-points over minuscule mistakes. How does she have time to be this ridiculous??
I took Lifespan Development with Roush online this semester. It was a pretty easy A, but make sure you read the textbook before taking exams. We did one group project that was simple. No biggie.
Totally awesome prof

Mr Beer is handsdown one of the best instructors at OSU. He provides detailed feedback, patiently explains complex concepts, really cares about his students collegiate & professional success. I feel lucky to have in his class. I dont know how he makes time for his students. I hope he stays at OSU until I graduate.

345 was a challenging class. The online delivery of the content, due to the pandemic, did not help. However, Dr Beer created interactive content and information and fun lecture every week. Dr Beer made himself available outside of class to explain some of the concepts and content that I found hard to understand. I liked that he used examples!

Professor Beer is an inspiration. I thought I was competent in my writing, reading, and research methods prior to this course. The whole semester Professor has made himself available to the class. He has helped me improve beyond what I thought was possible. Thank you!!!!!

I took the class because of Beer's research and knowledge of quantitative and qualitative methods. There are a lot of readings and lectures! Appreciate Dr Beer's proactive responses to feedback, such as having shorter but more lectures.

Dr. Oliver is a grade above any of their professor I have taken a class with. Dr. Oliver is welcoming, creative and dynamic in his teaching. His info graphics and videos will leave you speechless. Youll never need to worry about understanding a topic with him. He provides substantial feedback and always makes time for students.

Doctor Beer made online learning easier with loads of YouTube videos to explain concepts and expectations for the class. It would have been impossible to pass this class because it was online if we didnt have these videos and his passion for his students. He made me feel connected to the school and classmates.

I like Professor Beers approach to learning. None of my other professors used innovative approaches or techniques in the classroom. Professor Beer made it a lot easier to learn online compared to other professors.
Dr. Beer summarized what I had been trying to learn into 3 hours. Take this class if you want to understand statistics!
Professor Beer is exceptional and inspirational. He goes out of his way for all his students, responds to emails quickly, and continually adapts to the ever-changing online learning environment.

Oliver is the most proactive and engaging professor. He is genuinely lovely. If there are parts of the course we do not understand, he hosts open Zoom chats to discuss the topic and creates videos demonstrating the how to
took this class online as a session 2, it was not hard to keep up with the work. very organized and straightforward

loooved this class! content was well organized and interesting, professor latelle gave great feedback, all the assignments were straight forward, etc. there was a lot of reading but the fact that the content was engaging was really helpful. definitely would take again!

I took 6301 with Brian. He is a tough grader, but I do like that the class is heavily based on discussion. Attendance is mandatory. That being said, his class was not safe for LGBTQ+ students. Discussions were held that were very anti-trans and he did not stop those conversations from becoming hateful towards trans students in the classroom.

I took 6301 with Brian. He is a very tough grader. Although I did well in his class, there was no room for diversity in thought. You have to answer how he wants it done. Very lecture heavy. Points for attendance and participation are separate. Would not take another class with him.

Prof Bohl is a tough grader, but always gives you kind and helpful feedback that is detailed and will stop you from making the same mistakes for your next paper. He genuinely cares about students, and is quick to respond to email. Class content was engaging, I hope I have more classes with Prof Bohl in the future!

While enrolled in this course, I experienced some unrelated serious health concerns. When I reached out to the professor, he was caring and invested in my finishing the course. People fail to engage online professors, resulting in overlooked opportunities to grow academically & professionally. I recommend his class and copious, detail feedback.

This man is so condescending and expects every student to answer questions the exact same way. There is no room for diversity of thought. I received the worst grade on a paper I ever had even though I answered the questions, just not the way he wanted.

Took this class online, it wasnt absolutely awful. Professor Bohl does grade formatting pretty tough but overall he is really nice and I can tell he cares about the success of his students. He responds to emails pretty fast but grading papers may take over a week which can be frustrating. I would take this class if you have an option.

I wouldn't take this professor again unless there wasn't another option. He is a fairly tough grader, the quizzes have had some questions where all the answers were wrong and that wasn't a given choice. He provides no criteria standards. Also, you must answer questions very specific to what he expects not what the questions asks ( your opinion).
I really enjoyed Prof Bohls class. Gives great feedback, quickly so you can improve the next assignment using previous feedback. Always accessible.
Professor Bohl is a great teacher who really cares about his students. He actually wants you to succeed.

easy weekly assignments, easy grader, big project at the end of the semester is stressful, but he grades rather quickly and gives good feedback on each assignment, good intro to social work, I would recommend him!

Professor Bohl gives quite a bit of feedback on the midterm and final. He wants students to participate in class and he usually responds to e-mails pretty quickly. The biggest issue was submitting final grades in time, which could potentially be an issue for graduating seniors.

Dave is an excellent professor and a star in the field of social work. He deeply cares about his students and is clearly passionate about the subjects he teaches. He's one of the only professors that will teach you real therapeutic tools you can use in the field immediately. Love his classes so much I took a class of his almost every semester.

I have taken two classes with Dave Grove and he is one of the best professors I have ever had! He has an incredible wealth of knowledge and experience which he brings to his lectures, and does a great job of balancing his teaching from both the literature and his own experience. He cares about helping his students become great social workers.

Great professor for SWK 4501! I was hesitant about Grove's teaching style after the first 2 classes, but I really came to like his class (even at 8AM). He uses lots of real examples with videos. He would ask for our feedback on the class and actually use it to help us & make the class better. Make sure to show up, attendance is graded.

Professor grove has lots of experience and shares great stories with students. He isnt afraid to talk about the taboo subjects and is genuinely interested in what he can do to be a better professor and provide his students with a class that is different than others. Of all the teachers Ive had at OSU, this class changed me the most!
Daves great and super flexible and understanding!

Prof. Grove is a phenomenal teacher who speaks entirely from experience. He understands that social work is a field that requires improvization and compassion to work together. He genuinely cares that each of his students succeed and are able to provide families with the best possible non-judgemental care. Listening in his class will go a long way!

He is completely unequipped to teach a class about cultural competency and non-white settings in general. He needs to go back to college and know the world has changed and doesn't automatically cater to him anymore just because he is a white man. His class was depressing, especially since I felt I couldn't speak up.

Dave has great stories and has many, many years of experience. He is a LISW-S and a licensed family therapist. He cracks me up when he gets excited and his voice goes really high pitched. Likes to show videos and draw genograms. Great guy!

He is an awesome instructor. His class is more like a work setting, in which you actually have to think and solve the issue you are working on. It is not a just stand there do nothing and get nothing class. It will let you know what you have earn to that point and what you will still need to know.
Instructor unprepared. Lectures were primarily personal stories. If you are truly culturally ignorant, you won't learn here.

Grove is such an AWESOME instructor!  I would highly recommend him to anyone.  He gives a great deal of useful info & even gives wonderful pointers to help with the comps exam.  We are fortunate at OSU to have a great deal of good teachers, however Grove is in a class all by himself.  Take him if you can-you will not regret it!
Awesome teachers. Has really good stories. I would take him again if I could.

Dave has many interesting stories, and a wealth of experience to speak from.  Sometimes his class can be dull because it is not very interactive, just lots of him talking with NO breaks.  Nice hair though.  It would be tough to be interesting for 3 hours though I suppose.
Dave is such a great instructor!  He's funny, gives valuable examples, and is a good guy.  I looked forward to going to class :)
No Comments

I took Family Violence (SWK 5023) with Lois and she was a great. We had a textbook (which I never read) and a chapter book (great read!). We did a mindfulness activity at the beginning of each class. Assignments were pretty easy and straightforward. There was 1 group project. Master's student do a little extra work. Lots of guest speakers! 10/10.

I learned a lot for her and would say she is one of the best professors I've had at OSU. She's very understanding and accessible to students and getting an A requires an average amount of participation and effort. This class takes you out of your comfort zone but she makes the environment really comfortable and light hearted. 10/10

Lois is simply the best. She is relatable, and incredible with teaching ethical scenarios or real life situations. She says she's always available, and she means it. Stayed after class for 30 minutes to help counsel me on career goals and placements. She is hilarious, and her class is one I always looked forward to.
She's super nice and understanding. The course was passfail but I don't know how anyone could fail, unless she just did literally nothing.

Lois is a great instructor! She is very respectful of her students and has a lot of energy and enthusiasm. The only downfall of this course she taught was that she didn't grade hardly any of our assignments but it was mostly because she knew that we put in effort and the class was passfail.

Lois is kind of a jack of all trades. I see she is now teaching the DSM class and I'm upset that I have already taken it because I was not pleased with the instructor and I know that she would have been a better instructor.

Lois is one of the most wonderful professors I've ever had. She's engaging, warm, funny, and so insightful. She really cares about her students, and I LOVE that she teaches mindfulness exercises each class. I would take her every semester if I could!

Lois was amazing.  She is so knowledgeable, very clear in her teaching, and has very clear expectations.  She wants students to get the most out of her class and to leave with the ability to APPLY what we learn to our work.  Not all teachers care about that, but this is Lois' #1 priority.  She's also very funny!

Crisis intervention- Lois is one of my very favorite teachers and people in the SW dept. She is very passionate yet easy-going. She brings in a lot of outside experience and relates to students better than a lot of other adjunct professors do. Her goal is to get you to make sense of the material and come up with useful tools for yourself.

I WILL NEVER STOP SINGING THIS LADY'S PRAISES-SHE CHALLENGED ME TO STEP OUT OF MY BOX AND TO GROW IN WAYS THAT I NEVER THOUGHT POSSIBLE-TOOK RISKS AND WAS PROTECTED AND I'M THANKFUL FOR WHAT SHE TAUGHT ME-THIS WAS A CHOICE AND IT WAS AMAZING! SHE USED SO MANY DIFFERENT TEACHING METHODS EACH CLASS THAT YOU WERE EXHAUSTED AT THE END-SEEK LOIS OUT!
Lois has a great attitude and is a very upbeat teacher. She does not require a ton of required readings

Approaches teaching completely different from anything I have experienced before.  Does not stick to the old 3 multiple choice tests and a final paper format that everyone else does.  A completely enjoyable experience.

Her class was great.  She uses a variety of teaching styles in class and unlike some adjunct professors, is very knowledgeable about the subject matter and applies it well .  She is a sweet, genuine, passionate person.  Her class was also VERY easy.  There was 1 small paper and a group presentation.  I think just about everyone got an A on both
Great Instructor!

She is very flexible.  Her assigments are creative and useful.  She brings creative ideas into the classroom and has a unique teaching style.  I wish more professors used her teaching techniques.  I learned a great deal in her class.

I took 6401 with Jerry. He is great at giving feedback on papers. There were 3 main papers for this online class. Easy grader as long as you try your best! Provided clear grading guidelines. I will definitely take another class with him if I get the chance.
Professor Bean was wonderful for this class! I will take him again in the future. This class had 3 papers and all were manageable! Great communication!

I heard everyone in my cohort complaining about their prof for this class and I was SO happy I took Dr. Bean. He is easily accessible, did a great job making lectures online easy to understand and had clear expectations. I was nervous to take this class online but it was a great experience. Grade is based on quizzes, discussion posts, and 3 papers

He's one of the nicest instructors in the Social Work department and actually connects with students on a personal level. Very funny, always has a quick wit. Makes life easier and explains exactly what he wants and never makes a class difficult.

Very funny guy and tries to make a boring class interesting. He is the easiest grader in the world but he tends to not be clear for what he wants in assignments at least for this class. What was expected for assignments changed on a regular basis and made things very difficult especially after you already start on one and have to change it.

Jerry was great! He tried to make a somewhat dull subject fun and was lenient with assignments as long as you learned the material. There was a required semester-long project and he lets you work at your own pace. It wasn't bad at all and you learn a lot. Didn't even buy the required book. I definitely recommend taking the class with him!

I'm glad that I took this course online with Jerry, as I've heard a lot of bad things about other sections with other professors. This class took some worktimeeffort, but wasn't actually all that strenuous. He seemed to give good feedback to students throughout, but gave me zero feedback (other than a grade) on our big, final paper. Bummer!
Jerry is very helpful! He seems to love what he does!
Easygoing, nice guy. Helpful, funny, good sense of humor.
Wonderful guy. Very helpful and funny.
Easy, very understandable.
Bean is a great teacher. You do not need to buy the book for his class. He is a really easy going, nice, and compasionate guy and is always willing to help.
He's the best!

I took 6201 with Debra and it was a very interesting class. This was a difficult class for me but the professor provided great feedback on assignments and clear grading criteria. This made future assignments easier to complete. As long as you participate she will work with you. Easy to contact outside of class. She knows her stuff!

I am out-of-state in the online MSW program, and four of my courses are synchronous with regular 3 hour-long course meetings. Hilliard keeps these long lectures interesting with videos and plenty of opportunities for class comments and discussion on topics. She's the best professor I have this semester. The assignments are useful, and she's smart.

Zach really knows his stuff when it comes to policy and social work practice. I learned way more than I was expecting to in seminar. He is also very lenient with due dates and when grading he cares more about content than format.

Brandy is one of the best instructors I've ever had! She really cares about her students, makes a four hour class fun and engaging, and is extremely helpful and knowledgeable. Her interest is mental health and micro work so if you are interested in that take her! She is kind funny and an easy grader and I would take every class with her if I could!

Prof Warne is incredibly down to earth and makes sure students are engaged throughout the semester. She provides lots of opportunities to practice social work skills through role play and tailors her case examples to fit the interests of the class. She grades fairly and has a fantastic sense of humor. Easily the best prof I've had so far.

This class involved SW ethics and the basics of techniques that help build therapeutic rapport with clients. It was a live online class, and Brandy gave lots of opportunities for roleplay, not only in video assignments but also in class both in groups and pairs with other students. If you want to be a therapist or work well with clients, take her.

Ian is really good at giving extra resources, and explaining things in email or in assignment feedback. The class isn't super easy since it's online, but he makes his own videos that really help to understand the assignments.

I am taking her for SW7401 evaluation. She is a great professor, and good at her job. However, I have aced social work and breezed through the entire program. I got my first D in her class. HARD Grader. I would recommend if you want to be challenged, not if you want an easy grade.
Michelle made Human Trafficking interesting. Great teacher. Great Class.

Awful professor. Knowledgeable on subject matter but uses that as an excuse to grade strictly, regardless of whether you read it from course material, she knows more!

Unwilling to help students. Provides opportunities unevenly, would not recommend unless she is your last option.

Professor allowed students with a B or lower on papers to redo. But no other opportunities given to students who messed a couple things up. Rubrics never actually helped, if you included everything requested she would point out things that were never mentioned in class. Papers nearly every week.

There was a paper every 2 weeks. She purposely made it that papers begin very difficult and become easier. I never was able to get a perfect grade on any paper, despite following all the guidelines/rubric criteria. Students who got lower than a B- get a chance to redo, so in the end, folks who did worse than me had better grades. Poor professor.
Absolutely awesome professor. She made everything interesting and used her real world knowledge to really add to the class.  Take any classes you can with her!!!

She was a great instructor and really cared about how you learned. I really liked how she brought really life scenarios to the classroom that was really helpful! Great professor I would definitely take her again!

Best teacher to ever happen to me!! I loved her and hope to take her again. I've gone to two colleges, changed majors and had a lot of good and bad teachers - she is the best teacher I've had, hands down.

She is extremely compassionate and insightful and a lot of fun to have as a professor.  744 is a pass/fail class so I can't say much about how difficult she is.  I would definitely take another class with her.  She makes class alot of fun
WONDERFUL, AMAZING, GREAT!! Take any class you can with her!!
Amazing, I loved her!!!!!!
No Comments

I was very intimidated by this course as I had done very little research and analysis in undergrad. I thought I didn't understand the material, but followed his guidelines and did well. He gave timely, thorough feedback. I feel I learned a lot from him and will take classes with him in the future. He also gives random extra points for discussions.
*Took 7400* Would for sure take a class form this prof in the future. He grades quickly with feedback. He is able to be contacted outside of class. Course material is understandable.
I found that online live sessions were rambling and without a lot of purpose. Got a lot of harsh negative feedback that was more critical than constructive.

Dr. Bean is an excellent professor that will make sure you pass the course. He gives his personal and encourages students to call him rather than email. Prefers concise work and not picky about the number of pages. Glad I am ending my masters with him.
Dr. Bean is an excellent professor! He is very accessible and gives his personal number. He is willing to help students as much as possible and will make sure you pass the class.
Amazingly helpful, knowledgeable, and encouraging. It is obvious he really cares about his students and meaningful social work practice. Highly recommend!

Many students may find her difficult as her expectations are high, but I liked her high standards. She motivated and challenged me to learn more and do my best. I have never received such detailed feedback in discussions and assignments. I always found her to be extremely knowledgeable and very forthcoming.

The class in general is boring. The online format made it worse. Dr. Maleku knows her stuff but there are so many assignments back to back, she takes forever to give feedback, and she is a difficult grader.

I took a doctoral-level mixed methods research course with Dr. Maleku and I was fascinated by her class! I am not in social work and went to the College of Social Work to take this course as this is probably the only mixed methods course available on campus. Dr. Maleku is extremely knowledgeable and a very rigorous mixed-methods researcher.

I read great things about this professor and was eager to learn. I found the course overwhelming and hard to follow due to slow grading and delayed feedback, not the content itself. There is a disconnect in this course online with gaps of no assignments and then a lot that are hard to piece together without guidance. Maybe this is best on campus.

I took the 7400 Evidence in Social Work Class. Dr. Maleku has been the best professor I ever had at OSU. She is amazingly knowledgable, very rigorous, but extremely supportive. I learned so much about research, which I hated in 8 weeks of summer class, which I had never learned in my entire undergraduate. I hope i have more classes with her.

I took the doctoral level mixed methods research course with Dr. Maleku and was blown away! I really appreciate the effort Dr. Maleku put into this course. She always had comprehensive well-structured lectures with very clear examples of everything she was introducing. Her detailed feedback continually helped me to get a good grasp of things.

Even in the middle of the pandemic, I thoroughly loved the class and would like to follow the social work career. Dr. Maleku is extremely knowledgeable and wants you to develop your critical thinking. It is a tough class, but it is worth it because you will learn a lot. I am grateful to Dr. Maleku.

Best research class I had ever taken. I am not a fan of research courses, but I was very impressed with the way Arati taught this class. It was an online class. Arati took the time to give feedback and did live sessions, which were always enriching! You have to work hard. I would love to take face to face classes with her any day!

Dr. Maleku is the most rigorous professor I have met at the College. She s extremely knowledgeable and expects a lot of rigor in your work. It is a very tough class, but it is totally worth it as you will learn a lot. I wish I had her in my other classes prior to my graduation.

Arati is one of the best instructors i had at OSU. She is extremely knowledgeable and it shows. She challenged me to think critically and engaged in conversations that honestly i had never paid attention to in social work. She does expect a lot, but also gives many opportunities to do well in class. I would take her class any day !

Dr. Maleku is an amazing instructor. It was a touch class, but she is very supportive to the learning needs of the students. Her class to me was intellectually stimulating. I literally learned so much in her class even when i combine what i learned in two other classes this semester.

There is no denying she is very knowledgeable in the course content but seems very busy with other obligations in her career. The course structure is rather disorganized with a lot of stagnant time sitting in groups and lectures being read word for word off the slides. Was also very slow to grade the only 3 assignments in the class.

It was very clear she was very knowledgeable in the subject. She has a lot of experience she can share with the class. She gave a lot of time in class to work our project which was also helpful. Given all of that, I was still not a fan of her. This is because she was rather dismissive and rude to students when they participated.

Course work is difficult but Dr. Maleku is very fair. She takes the time to grade everything you turn in and gives you the opportunity to ace the class if you do the work. I learned a lot in this class and I did a lot of work. I am proud of the final group paper we turned in. Dr. Maleku is one of the professors that makes OSU great.

Professor Arati is a gem to the college of Social Work! She really cares about us and wants us to learn. I wasn't interested in Macro social work until I took a class with her. The class is challenging but so worth it! I learned so much and feel more confident with taking other Macro classes. The class activities were enjoyable and she was great!

I had many medical problems this semester, and Professor Koe- Krompecher was so easy to reach and accommodated me through everything. They are extremely quick to reply to emails which is helpful being in an online class. 

Rubrics were given for papers, and application was in real world assignments. 

12/10 would recommend to take their class.

The class itself was useful, the problem is we were given essentially given no communication or feedback from Prof Quinn throughout the semester. She was perpetually behind on grading to the point that it caused a great deal of stress. By the final week of the semester over half the assignments submitted in the class were still ungraded.

Super disappointed in the class and professor. This is an asynchronous online class but Dr. Quinn is 6 weeks behind on grading discussions, doesn’t answer emails, sends out partly pre-written announcements that don’t match the current week. Strict timeline for assignments but doesn’t grade for weeks. Unorganized. Avoid!

Prof Quinn was essentially an absent prof, behind 6 weeks and counting on discussion posts that feedback would be valuable to have for major writing assignments. I would not and will not take a class taught by her again.

This was probably one of the worst courses I have taken. The professor did not grade in a timely matter. She took over 4 weeks to grade one of our assignments and usually takes weeks to grade the smaller assignments. She barely responds to emails.

The best professor I have ever had at OSU, her lectures were fun and engaging and made the class feel like a family. I came in as an undecided major and as I leave her class I am very strongly considering the Social Work major. Highly recommend her to anyone who has the chance.

Dr. B was absolutely amazing. She was so understanding, was very accessible outside of class, and helped me to view the world in so many different ways. Shes an inspiration, and truly loves what she does! 10000% would take any class with her. A couple papers & quizzes, other than that just show up to class.

The best teacher I have ever had at Ohio State. She is such an inspiring person who has changed the way I think about the world. I took this class to explore the social work major; it didn't count as a credit but it easily became one of my favorite classes of the semester. There is a book, but you don't need to read it. Attendance is mandatory.
She is an amazing, beautiful woman who has amazing personal stories, but I didn't feel I learned much in the class. It was scattered and extremely discussion based...barely any content.
She is very kind, but I just really couldnt bring myself to care about a single word that came out of her mouth. I would take this class again in a heartbeat.

Shivani isn’t a prof I would want again. She takes points off of assignments, with no feedback as to why, and isn’t quick with answering emails. She also is very firmly anti-Zoom and will count you as absent even if you ask for a Zoom due to a genuinely good reason for missing class.
If you are taking social work, you should take Mrs. Edwards.  She is helpful, encouraging, understanding and one of those teachers you wish could follow you around until graduation helping you learn.

Prof. Kinsway is one of the go-to folks for school social work at OSU. She clearly knows her stuff and takes the time to engage with students. While the class isn't terribly challenging, if you participate and do the work, you will actually learn something. If you are going into school social work, take at least one class with Teri.

Teri is a great professor! However, if you're choosing an elective during a busy semester, keep in mind she is a tough grader and has extremely high expectations. The class required a lot of participation and became quite overwhelming. If she's teaching a class you really care about, definitely choose her, but maybe skip for electives.

Great class and an amazing professor. Teri gives very helpful feedback and you can tell she truly cares about her students. The class is very easy and self-explanatory if you take the time to really know the NASW Code of Ethics. I learned SO much about ethical practices that are absolutely required if you want to be a social worker.

Teri is wonderful. You will learn so much because she genuinely cares about the social work field and how it is taught. She really wants to make sure that future social workers are going to be successful.
Extremely helpful, very understanding.  Passionate, highly recommend.

Teri is one of the most passionate, compassionate, and understanding teachers at OSU.  She has a desire to inspire students and teach about the profession.  She is also a real human, and understands students' needs both academically as well as personally.

Teri is very clear about her expectations, and she is so understanding/accommodating to the needs of students.  She tries to make class interesting by using a variety of teaching techniques.  But her lecturing skills are not very great and she seems to become shy when there's a power point presentation in front of her.

She has obvious care for the profession of SW and for the well-being of her students. She's encouraging, helpful, and experienced.  She's very clear about her expectations, and doesn't grade hard.  Women's Studies--> not that great.  Practice Lab--> She was AWESOME!!!
No Comments

Teri is a great professor who teaches a discussion- driven class. She plans meaningful activities and the teaching tools appeared to be carefully selected. We NEVER got out early...and the only complaint I would have is not enough time! I would take her again and encourage others to do the same!

She was not helpful at all, and class time was a complete waste.  We got out early every time, and hardly talked about relevant material.  She seemed willing to find out info when she didn't know something.  Took forever to grade papers.

I took Professor Kathryn's online psychopathology class and learned a lot from her. She provides good feedback when grading. I do wish that she had told us more about traumatic brain injuries during the class; it's not super related to the class content but it's her specialty area. You can learn a lot from her. Helps with paper formatting too.

Professor Kathryn is awesome! I was going through a lot of personal stuff this semester and she was really understanding and gave me extra time to finish my assignments. She is a tough grader but fair. I learned a lot from her and she clearly cares about her students. I hope to take another class she teaches!

Sabina is an awesome professor. I learned so much from his class and he really cares about the subjects. As long as you follow directions and do the homework, he grades pretty easily. I am taking a second class with him and I would suggest him to anyone who really wants to learn something.
Professor Sabino is an amazing instructor. If you show up to class and participate in his class you will be good. He is not a bad grader just put in the work and you will pass the class just fine.
So finicky. Craft your every discussion post meticulously and make them half-page long or you will lose point! Vague directions and you have no idea why he is grading stuff that way. One word, picky.

Took this class in person and was incredibly disappointed. Spent up to an hour every week going over highs and lows, and it typically ended with classmates trauma dumping. Content was highly repetitive, and Angie gave little feedback but graded tough. When I tried to reach out to her it took her 2+ weeks to respond to a 3 sentence email.

Angie's grading is very off-putting - takes forever to grade things and when she does, she seldom gives feedback. There was a point where there were two papers ungraded and students could not use feedback to gauge where to improve. She canceled class frequently and was virtually impossible to get ahold of via email. I do not recommend her courses.

Weekly assignments based on discussion that require tons of out of class reading. When you ask her a question about something in class, she just shrugs. Was terrible at responding to email, my entire class was frustrated with her late grades and non responsiveness. Do not take her class, I did not learn anything. Very repetitive content.

Jon was a really nice guy but a really tough grader. He truly cares about the material and expects students to put in the work to learn it just as well as he knows it. It was refreshing to have a professor so invested, however, it came off as him making the class way more difficult than other professors in the program.

Nice instructor, but very picky grader down to the t, even for discussion posts. When grading, seems like his goal is to look for something to pick apart in your assignment. Willing to help outside of class but did not really feel like he was supportive or understanding. Felt like I needed to be as knowledgeable about the class material as he was.

This was his first time teaching, but you would not know that if he hadn't told us. Final project worth 35% of grade; the highest anyone scored was a B+! Tough grader. Thus, dinged GPAs. If GPA matters, steer clear. Repetitive lectures, reviewed each week. Quizzes-dropped lowest score. Enjoyed overall, but disappointed with outcome.

Dr. Jarrott was a wonderful instructor. She gives wonderful feedback to make your project better. She provided a video with feedback on one paper. There are four assignments that are all based on the same project. She does take points off for not following all the criteria but sometimes its .25 of a point. You learn a lot from her and this class.
Grades too tough and has high expectations. Expects you to know every concept and will not give specific reasons as to why she takes points off. Take a class with a different professor.

Unreal expectations. Hit every prompt for discussion board and wrote a full page and still not good enough. This is an online class. Expecting full papers with APA cites on 2 discussions per week is insane.

Stopped grading after week 4 all the way up until finals week. Terrible communication! Never responded to any of my emails. Took this class online which was a mistake because the content isn't clear, and she never could be reached. She did grade easy so that's one plus

This professor hasn't graded ANYTHING since week 4; we are now in finals week. The only thing that has been "graded" since September 18th is quizzes that are automatically graded by Carmen. She sent 1 email in September to explain lack of contact but then there was no further communication about grading. It's stressful not knowing how you're doing

This was meant to be a synchronous online course, but we only had three scheduled class meetings, one of which was canceled. The professor seemed to have a lot going on in her life and barely responded to anyone's messages. She also did not grade most of our assignments until the end, so it was difficult to know how we were doing.
Her class was soooo confusing. Hard to know what was going on. Constantly pushed the lesson back each week. Then Disappeared during COVID. Was of no help for our final project.

Classes were mandatory, but we only had 7 synchronous the entire semester. We got to build our own group- not randomly assigned- and she gave us some space to discuss ideas and interests before group selection. She made evidence & research related content as interesting as possible and facilitated some really interesting discussions.

I am 6 weeks into the class and have no idea what's going on. Exams are easy because it's open book. This professor cannot teach well. If there is another research professor for 3402 social work take him/her. It would really behoove of you to avoid her and this is coming from an (A) student.

The class is not easy. Lauren really makes you work for her class and your grade. However, she really wants you to learn and she is incredibly fair. She will go out of her way to meet with you if you need extra help. I feel confident going into my next research classes, because I learned so much this semester.

So many people take her classes because of HER. She is invested, interesting, and pulls off a great online class. Guest lecturers, small group discussions about topical readings, creative projects. Can even forgive the group project (which can be done solo) because the assignment was so interesting. Captivating midterm project. She's great!

Professor Daron has useful knowledge to share on human development and has obviously had a long career in social work that she uses to elucidate important concepts. One long project is a bit convoluted and unclear, but I felt the case study assignments were very useful. She sometimes seems annoyed during class in a way that can be offputting.

I have taken her for two classes 6201 and 6302 and got A's in both classes. She states everything she is looking for in the papers so it is not hard to get a good grade. Don't be afraid to ask questions if you are confused she will help but might take a day to get an answer back. I'm actually taking another class with her this fall.
This was a class about substance use and mental health. This class had 2 major projects which were both manageable. The discussion post was fair. It was a good class. She communicated back via email.

Angie is a great professor! She is so caring, and always available for questions. She is a bit of a stickler on papers, but her feedback can help you become a much better writer if you listen. She is also super funny, and goes out of her way to make everyone comfortable. If you get the chance to take a class with her, take it!

For an intro class, I honestly wasn't expecting the level of work she is dishing out. We have papers due every week, and besides the quizzes the only other way to earn points is through participation. You must go to class. It's unlikely you will receive full points on your papers. She'll always find something.

Expect a lot of papers, ex: one discussion post was actually 2 parts. Pt 1 was to watch a video and write an entire biopsychosocial assessment on it then discuss how yours compares to others. Pt 2 was to write a treatment plan. Each part worth 2 points. She is overly picky, half a point off for random typos or random aspects.

I had some issues in the semester that made it impossible to complete the course, she was not understanding and made trying to make a plan to finish very difficult. I would not recommend this professor- seems like someone in the social work field would be more understanding of a mental health crisis and try to help a student out. Worst instructor.

Expectations for assignments were often unclear and not reflected in her grading. During nearly every session of this grad-level course, she said of some topic, "This isn't really my area of expertise." That was usually followed by a YouTube video explaining the topic, instead. She was nice, but too timid and unsure of her own qualifications.
Don't wait till the last minute to do your papers and definitely don't turn them in late, she'll dock you points.
Easy class

She is very unclear on her instructions to papers, and goes over what she really expects the day the paper is due.  This is extremely frustrating for those who aren't procrastinators and actually finish the paper ahead of time.  Her lectures are boring and she didn't seem knowledgeable enough on the subject.  It takes her weeks to grade papers.

This professor is one of the more difficult ones that I have taken. She takes the course very seriously, and you will learn from the things provided. Of the three online course sessions, none of them were actually about teaching, instead they were about the upcoming projects, which was helpful but would have been nice Mohave some instruction also.
